Swearing-in reception for Congressman Brown held on Tuesday, January 3rd 2017 at the Library of Congress

The Manufacturing Bootcamp at The Foundery  is an innovative workforce development program that gives participants exposure to a broad range of industrial skills including woodworking, welding, and 3D printing, and gets them equipped to explore job opportunities available right now. Coupled with City Garage  – an incubator for tech and manufacturing companies – they are important first steps to reviving Port Covington​ and hopefully models we can replicate across Maryland.

I held my first 'Coffee and Conversation' at the Kettering Largo Perrywood Community Center to discuss the Affordable Care Act with community leaders, advocates and constituents. Because of the #ACA, nearly 500,000 Marylanders now know the financial security of health insurance and the uninsured rate has never been lower.   The GOP plan to repeal the #ACA will hurt poor and middle class families by putting insurance companies back in charge of health care, raising premiums, increasing the cost of prescription drugs, taking critical consumer protections and benefits away from the more than 150 million Americans with coverage through the work place, and eliminating the health insurance of 32 million people who have it today.   No law is perfect but my goal is to fix the ACA by lowering cost, expanding access and improving benefits. I appreciate the insights and stories from everyone who participated today including AARP Maryland, Greater Baden Medical Services Inc, Prince George's County Health Department, Maryland, and Maryland Health Connection

On Wednesday I joined with Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer for a town hall at Lanham’s Diyanet Center of America and heard constituents - from different backgrounds and faiths - describe the anxiety and fear they feel since Trump's inauguration.   I was repeatedly asked about what we could do to oppose the unconstitutional #MuslimBan. The President has unfairly targeted religious and ethnic minorities and this directly damages our national security and undermines American values. I will not be silent and I will continue to fight, but your voice and ongoing engagement is critical as we stand together to protect our values.

This week I joined my colleagues from Maryland, Virginia and the District to ask the U.S. Government Accountability Office (GAO) to do a deep-dive on Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority's long-term funding and governance structure, and provide recommendations for changes. #WMATA is the only transit agency to be governed by four separate entities without a dedicated funding source and this study could provide valuable perspective.  We also introduced bipartisan legislation to officially create a new Metro Safety Commission that will help establish tough new safety rules and enforcement mechanisms. Congress needs to move forward on this and stand up this Commission expeditiously.  Many of you depend on the Metro system for your daily commute and to get around our region, and are too often confronted with frustrating wait times and outages. You deserve a dependable transit system that will get you where you need to go safely and on time. We need cut through the dysfunction that has plagued WMATA for too long, and ensure the Metro system operates efficiently, effectively and safely today and into the future.

We need national redistricting reform. That's why I've sponsored the Redistricting Reform Act that would set up independent multi-party commissions that would prioritize public participation, fair representation and transparency when drawing maps in every state.   Leaders on both sides of the aisle - including Governor Hogan - should be be forceful advocates to end partisan gerrymandering across the country.

Today is the last day of Black History Month, but that by no means gives us the right to forget about the progress we fight for every day. It is a time where we renew our obligation to press on; that no matter how hard things get, we keep the faith, we keep fighting and we keep moving forward. I am confident that by standing together we can keep moving toward a more inclusive, a more just and a more perfect union. #BlackHistoryMonth

During President Trump’s #JointAddress last night, he spoke about creating jobs, investing in infrastructure, promoting paid family leave and affordable child care, and supporting our military and veterans. But talk is cheap. We need move beyond sloganeering and rally rhetoric and see real plans and details.   The President has been in office for 40-days and we still have no jobs plan, no plan to strengthen health care, and no plan to defeat ISIS. In the first 40-days of President Obama’s term, he had already signed a jobs and investment bill  that would create or save over 4-million jobs.   Especially on the Affordable Care Act, President Trump and Congressional Republicans remain committed to taking away health care coverage from 20 million people but cannot coalesce around a replacement that fulfills the President's promises of covering people with pre-existing conditions, strengthening Medicaid, and driving down the cost of prescription drugs.   The American people need to hear the plans and Congress needs to see the details - not listen to yet another campaign sales pitch devoid of substance.
Joined Larry White and over 150 community leaders a thte sixth annual Black History Celebration at the Wiley h. Bates Legacy Center
#IStandWithPP because women & families in Maryland and across our country rely on their services for affordable care. I'll fight efforts to cut funding for women's health or restrict access

Today it became clear that Attorney General Jeff #Sessions lied under oath about his interactions and relationship with Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak during the campaign. The Attorney General has betrayed the trust of the American people, and weakened the faith they have in our justice system. Mr. Sessions is not fit to serve as the nation's top law enforcement officer or oversee the investigation into Russian meddling into our elections. He must immediately resign.

Barely a few hours after his inauguration, President Trump raised mortgage costs on working families in the Fourth District and across the country who aspire to achieve the American Dream of owning a home.  Today, I introduced HR1321 - the first bill I have authored during the 115th Congress - to reverse this decision and reduce the high cost of mortgage insurance and make homeownership more accessible and affordable for many.   This bill would reduce costs for 750,000-850,000 borrowers across the country in 2017, and make homeownership possible for an additional 30,000-40,000 homebuyers. The average family in Anne Arundel and Prince George's Counties would save more than $500 a year.

President Trump signed a new #travelban designed to prevent  citizens of Muslim-majority nations and all refugees from entering the US. While the Administration has tried to avoid the chaos and political fallout, this new #MuslimBan does nothing to make us safer, deeply undermines American values, and is still unconstitutional.   As we continue to work to prevent this illegal ban from going into effect, remember all people in the US  - whether citizen or non- citizen - have rights:

This Saturday, I will be holding a town hall at Anne Arundel Community College. Everyone is welcome!   As your Congressman, I will always make myself available to my constituents. Conducting town halls, reading your letters, and listening to your concerns gives me the opportunity to do my job more effectively. Disagreement on issues is a fundamental part of democracy and our political process, but finding solutions that better the lives of Maryland families is an idea we all can get behind.

The GOP health care plan to gut Medicaid - a program that the working poor, children, seniors and people with disabilities depend on - and turn it into a voucher is wrong and simply disgraceful. You are playing with people's lives by denying them critical care.   Republicans say they want to "modernize" Medicaid but instead they are taking a meat cleaver to a cost-efficient program that cuts poverty, improves health and saves lives.

On International Women's Day and during Women’s History Month – we celebrate the successes of America’s women throughout history, and renew our commitment to fight for equal rights. Events like the Women's March on Washington and #DayWithoutAWoman remind us that the fight for equality is far from over.  I'm committed to #BeBoldForChange in fighting for women's rights and advocating for new opportunities to provide women with the economic security that they deserve and their families need.
Deltas are making their voice heard on Capitol Hill. I'll keep standing with them on the Affordable Care Act, funding of our HBCUs and protecting voting rights

I supported the bipartisan defense funding bill that closes the gaps in readiness and manpower, invests in research and development, prioritizes the procurement of new equipment and technology, and fully funds a much deserved pay raise for our troops. This bill is a solid start for the work we have to do this Congress.

President Trump has put forth a shallow budget of only $5 million to sustain clean-up efforts of the Chesapeake Bay. That is a 93% cut that will imperil restoration efforts. This titanic-sized cut is not only an affront to the hard-fought progress we've made, but also the communities across six states and D.C. that depend on the Bay.   Since 1983, the Chesapeake Bay Program has coordinated a regional partnership with surrounding states, 19 federal agencies, nearly 1,800 local governments, over 20 academic institutions, and more than 60 non-governmental organizations to restore and protect the Bay. We've seen real improvements in recent years.   I urge President Trump to rethink this drastic cut, and consider the 18 million people in the Chesapeake Bay watershed that will be impacted.

The selection of a location for the new FBI headquarters has delayed again by the Trump Administration. Prince George’s County is the best choice for the FBI, and I urge my colleagues in Congress to fully fund the relocation. There are not only 11,000 jobs on the line, but continued delays will have a negative impact on the safety and security of our nation..

For almost 2 hours I answered questions from constituents at Anne Arundel Community College on a host of issues -- keeping health insurance affordable and accessible, strengthening Social Security, protecting the environment, and ensuring all our kids get a world-class education. In Congress I will continue to fight for our values and by working together I am confident we can resist the dangerous Trump and GOP agenda.
NA

President Trump promised that no one would lose coverage under his plan - and that could not be further from the truth. Today the Congressional Budget Office announced that 24 million more people would be uninsured, millions - especially the elderly - would pay more for care, and Medicaid would end as we know it #PayMoreForLess

Yesterday, Republicans attacked the credibility of a nonpartisan analysis that showed the Republicans’ #RxForDisaster bill would kick 24 million Americans off their health care. Now, we’re learning that the White House’s internal numbers show that number is actually 26 million. The hypocrisy is astounding! https://goo.gl/mEXvmK

Join me on Saturday at Prince George's Community College for my next Town Hall. We have a lot to discuss, so make sure you RSVP.  I know many of you have questions regarding GOP plan to take away your health care, President Trump's agenda and how we can continue to be engaged and stand up for our values. Listening to your concerns and keeping your informed is the critical part of my job, and I will always make myself available to my constituents.

Today I managed the floor as the House considered 3 bills - including H.R.267 sponsored by my esteemed colleague John Lewis. This bill would designate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr's final resting place in Georgia as a national historic park thereby enhancing our ability to share Dr. King's story and preserve his legacy, and connect it with our ongoing struggle for civil rights.

Where do I even start with Trump's budget proposal?   President Trump's drastic cuts to key federal programs and agencies is nothing but an ideological crusade that will be devastating for American families and our shared values. Trump takes a sledgehammer to the EPA and eliminates climate change research, endangers medical research by abandoning the NIH, damages our global diplomatic efforts by cutting the State Department by 29% and zeroes out Community Development Grants that revitalize neighborhoods and funds programs like Meals on Wheels.    This budget is will hurt Marylanders. It defunds the Purple Line, invests $0 in Chesapeake Bay restoration, shutters the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, makes it harder to recruit and train teachers for high-need schools, slashes Pell Grants and will lead to significant layoffs. All the while it makes no investments to develop a 21st century workforce, expand opportunity to more or strengthen our infrastructure.

Honored to be presented with the U.S. Army seal from Colonel Howerton. As a 30 year Army veteran I am very familiar with the Army's motto "This We'll Defend" - which is at the top of the Army emblem. These words trace back to the Continental Army but remains relevant today. This seal will be proudly displayed in my office and I will always remember the courage and commitment of our soldiers, civilians and military families

President Trump talks a lot about investing in infrastructure but his budget would derail the Purple Line - a shovel-ready project that would create thousands of new jobs, spark economic development and reduce congestion. This is bad news for our region and a partisan assault on transit everywhere. I will do everything I can to maintain the federal commitment and keep the Purple Line moving forward.

It was a packed house at Prince George's Community College for my fifth #townhall! I understand there is a lot on your mind: the GOP plan to repeal the ACA and make health care more expensive; the impact of Trump's budget on affordable housing, the environment, medical research, and other important programs; concern about if resources will be taken from our public schools and given to private schools; and, the push to end Medicaid as we know it. But the best way we can #resist is by staying engaged and continuing to stand together for our shared values.  I'll keep fighting and I'll always have your back.

I welcomed Colombian Ambassador Juan Carlos Pinzón to Capitol Hill today and had a productive meeting. Our strategic relationship is critical to the Hemisphere, and I am pleased that Colombia and the insurgent group FARC are taking the needed steps to implement their historic peace deal. The US must keep its promises to support these critical post-conflict efforts.  I am deeply troubled that President Trump's budget has proposed drastic cuts to our diplomatic efforts and foreign aid. These choices will weaken the US-Colombian alliance and endanger the hard-fought peace. As the number of overdose deaths involving cocaine and heroin reach record levels, abandoning our partnership with Colombia will have a significant impact on the public health crisis my District and communities across America. I am committed to restoring cuts to aid and continuing our friendship.

Not only would the GOP #TrumpCare bill cost 24 million Americans their health coverage, it would result in killing nearly 2 million jobs. Why are Republicans rushing to vote on this disastrous bill this week?

Hundreds of thousands of veterans and their family members have gained health coverage under the #ACA as the uninsured rate among veterans dropped by 42%. All of this is on the chopping block as the GOP rushes to pass their #PayMoreForLess repeal.

Tomorrow, I –  along with the Congressional Black Caucus  leadership – will meet with President Trump at the White House to discuss education, HBCUs, criminal justice reform, infrastructure, the budget, economic opportunity and healthcare. As part of a serious dialogue, we will be offering policy solutions that the Administration can tackle to support and empower the African American community.

Congressional Black Caucus leadership and I had a productive meeting with President Trump on education, criminal justice reform, voting rights, economic opportunity and ways to empower African American communities.  The President was engaged, respectful and demonstrated a willingness to continue the conversation with the CBC. During our discussion, I spoke specifically about the need to restore and expand Pell Grant funding, support HBCUs, and how the federal government can revitalize communities through investment and development.    The President expressed his desire to work with the CBC on these issues, and I will hold the President and his Administration to this commitment. President Trump and I have genuine disagreements, I continue to have concerns about the direction of his Administration, and my values will prevent me from supporting much of his agenda. But on infrastructure, workforce development, and supporting our veterans – there is the possibility of common ground.

0 hearings. 0 minutes of committee testimony. Republicans are still crafting the health care repeal bill behind closed doors hours away from a final vote. Why are Republicans in such a rush to take away health care from 24 million people, make care more expensive for seniors and the middle class, and end Medicaid as we know it?   The American people deserve better
Even as #Obamacare is becoming more and more popular, there is very little support for #TrumpCare. I'm not surprised. Who wants to pay more for less care?

I joined Senator Tammy Duckworth and fellow veterans in Congress to denounce #TrumpCare and its disastrous impact on our nation's veterans. Millions of veterans are being stripped of their ability to afford high-quality insurance and even more will be denied critical mental health, substance use and behavioral health services. This is not only wrong but shameful.
93% of my constituents have called in opposing #TrumpCare. I've heard you loud and clear. I will be voting NO

In America health care is a right for everybody, not a privilege for the few. This was a poorly crafted bill that would have kicked 24 million Americans off their health insurance; increased costs for veterans, seniors and middle class families; removed maternity care, prescription drug coverage and emergency room services from insurance plans; and, ended Medicaid as we know it. I am proud to have stood against this disastrous bill from day 1.   Real people rely on the Affordable Care Act. More people are insured today than ever before, seniors receive discounts on their prescription drugs and Americans are now getting free preventive care like mammograms and vaccinations. Just as we worked together to strengthen and improve Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid, I hope we can do more to lower costs and increase coverage in our healthcare system.   This victory belongs to the millions of Americans - including many in my District - who organized, mobilized and made their voices heard. This is the only way we can continue to  stand up against President Trump and resist the GOP agenda.

On Saturday, I'll be at Oxon Hill Library to discuss recent developments on Capitol Hill and listen to your thoughts and ideas. Even though we were successful in derailing the GOP's attempt to repeal health care, your continued engagement is critical as we move forward and keep pushing back

Once again, there are serious questions being raised about the behavior of a Trump Administration official with regards to meetings with the Russians. Speaker Ryan, we can wait no longer. The only appropriate answer is an independent commission to #FollowTheFacts.

Plain and simple, #TrumpCuts to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting (that would severely impact PBS and Maryland Public Television) are unconscionable. High quality programming like Sesame Street introduce kids - especially those from underprivileged homes -  to reading, math and science and improve learning outcomes in school.   The move to ax this program (approximately one hundredth of one percent of the entire federal budget) is yet another another example of the GOP gutting programs vital to middle class and working families.

As we approach the centennial of women earning the right to vote, we rededicate ourselves in the fight for equality for all people. Despite extraordinary odds, women have persevered throughout history – especially man women who call Maryland home. During #WomensHistoryMonth I took time to recognize the accomplishments of two amazing Marylanders: Honorable Judge Michele Hotten and Lorraine Sheehan

I stood with consumers and voted against the GOP effort to repeal #BroadbandPrivacy - a historic set of rules aimed at protecting our online data. I will not sit idly by while Republicans raid the privacy rights of Americans to pad the pockets of big business. Much of our personal data is more vulnerable now than ever, and these rules are necessary. These protections do not stifle innovation - they incubate creativity and support a free and open Internet.

I spent a few days on the USS Nimitz (CVN 68) as the crew trained off the coast of Southern California prior to their deployment this summer. The Nimitz, while the oldest carrier in the U.S. fleet, is still one of the world's great warships and key to our ability to project power across the globe.

Politicians shouldn't be telling scientist how to do their research. That's why I voted against the GOP bill to restrict the EPA's ability to use science to protect public health and the environment. This partisan effort will impede the EPA from using the best available science, harm their ability to conduct future research, will costs taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars a year, and makes it much easier for industry to pollute.   The ongoing Republican 'War on Science' and campaign to gut the EPA is wrong and comes at the detriment of the American people and future generations.

After pledging to help people struggling with addiction, this symbolic 'Opioid Commission' is underwhelming. We know what we need to do - increase treatment options for addicts and ensure insurers cover those benefits. Only 10% of people with an addiction get treatment.   The Trump Administration has proposed cutting addiction services, taking away health coverage from millions of substance abusers, and allowing insurance companies to stop offering mental health and drug addiction treatment. These will make the crisis worse.  We need a real strategy and sustained funding. Not platitudes

The Russian cloud over this White House and over our democracy is darkening and I called on Congress to come together to create a bipartisan, independent commission to investigate the full extent of Russia’s influence on the Trump Administration and our elections.   There are too many unanswered questions about financial ties, personal ties and political ties. And every new tie we discover is followed by another lie from the Administration. The American people are demanding answers now.

Across the country people are making their voices heard and Congress is listening. Residents in southern Prince George's County had a lot on their minds as Congress works to keep the government open. I'll work to stop the draconian #TrumpCuts and keep investing in our communities

Today I visited the U.S. Detention Center at Naval Station Guantanamo Bay. Currently 41 men are detained at GTMO and they include some of the most dangerous masterminds of the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001 and on the USS Cole.  The detainees are being treated pursuant to the Geneva Convention and are being tried by military commissions.   This has been a long, slow process.  The facilities and operations are expensive and raise many important questions about whether or not we should continue operating a top secret detention center in Cuba. Congress and the Administration must ensure that the 41 detainees are expeditiously prosecuted with the legal protections to which they are entitled, and that the military personnel who are tasked to do this work have all the resources they need.   What should be the future of this detention center?  Tell me what you think.

On #EqualPayDay we acknowledge our fight to close the gender pay gap is far from over. On average, women earn 80¢ for every dollar earned by men, and that divide widens for women of color. Over the course of her career a woman will lose nearly $500,000 because of the gender gap - enough to buy a house, save for college or fund her retirement. This is unacceptable.   To level the playing field, I've sponsored the Paycheck Fairness Act. This bill would eliminate loopholes in the Equal Pay Act, break harmful patterns of pay discrimination and strengthen workplace protections for women. 89% of Americans support these policies and it's time for Congress to finally pass this bill.

According to the National Partnership for Women & Families - Congressmember Karen Bass, Rep. Joe Crowley, Rep Nydia Velazquez, Rep Eddie Bernice Johnson and I represent the only congressional districts where women are paid equal to or slightly more than their male counterparts.   We have a lot more work to do to close the gender-wage gap once and for all.

I am monitoring situation of F-16 jet from Joint Base Andrews that crashed in Clinton this morning. The pilot - from 113th Wing: D.C. Air National Guard - safely ejected and has no major injuries. There have been no reports of injuries on the ground.  I appreciate the professionalism and dedication of Prince George's County first responders and the military personnel who were quickly on the scene. The decisions the pilot took before crashing, undoubtedly saved lives.  UPDATE (10:30 AM): Aircraft was on a training mission and was clear of live ammunition. Homes in the area of Temple Hills Rd and Woodelves Way are being evacuated to Clinton Grove Elementary School. Emergency personnel are going door-to-door.   UPDATE (11:00 AM): Lengthy road closures are expected around Temple Hills Road, Piscataway Road and Steed Road. Please avoid the area. Residents will not be allowed to return to their homes at this time  UPDATE (12:30 PM): Parts from the crashed F-16 could be spread over a wide area southern Prince George's County. If you find something suspicious, please do not move or touch it. Call 240-612-4428/4430 to reach personnel at Joint Base Andrews  UPDATE (2:30 PM): Residents are being allowed back to their homes and road closures in the area are being lifted.
Steven Bannon - Trump's alt-right political strategist - should have never been on the National Security Council in the first place. Next, he should be removed from the White House

After Republicans refused to meet with, hold a hearing or vote on President Obama's Supreme Court nominee -  I strongly stand with my Democratic colleagues in the Senate,  including Senator Ben Cardin and Senator Chris Van Hollen, as they filibuster Neil Gorsuch.  Gorsuch’s lifelong appointment to the Court would have dire consequences for many Americans, especially African Americans and other vulnerable communities.   We need a moderate consensus nominee who respects workers’ rights, doesn't rule consistently in favor of the privileged, remains impartial to corporate bias and can answer basic questions during the confirmation process. Gorsuch has proved that he can do none of this.

#TBT When I delivered a letter to President Trump asking him to end the delays and move the FBI headquarters project forward. Prince George's County has the best sites and can deliver a new modern headquarters on-time and cost-effectively. Further delay is not in the best interests of thousands of FBI employees, taxpayers or our national security.

Last night the precision strikes against the Syrian air base delivered a clear message that use of chemical weapons cannot and will not be tolerated by the United States. These strikes were a proportional response to Assad’s attack against innocent civilians and will degrade his ability to use chemical weapons in the future.  President Trump must now provide the American people and Congress with a clear strategy to address the civil war, destruction and the loss of life in Syria. Congress and the American people are entitled to a debate on our military objectives and strategy, and our troops deserve a commitment of resources to achieve those objectives. The President must come before Congress for the authority to use military force against another sovereign nation. Any future Authorization for Use of Military Force should be combined with robust diplomatic and economic efforts to bring stability to this region.   Moving forward, the United States must work with our international partners to end this conflict and humanitarian crisis. We must not forsake the suffering of the Syrian people and should open our doors to welcome those in need. It is clear that we must fully fund the State Department’s diplomatic and foreign assistance efforts. As a member of Congress, I will do everything I can to ensure our troops and diplomats have the resources they need to protect the United States and the vulnerable around the world.

Please join me for an open house celebration at my Prince George's district office in Largo. This is an opportunity for you to meet the team, voice your concerns and learn about the variety of services my office provides.   Hope to see you there!

I send my warmest greetings to the millions of Jewish families in Maryland and around the world celebrating Passover. As we take time to untangle the threads that connect us, we remember that we have more in common with our neighbors than we have differences. Holy Week, Easter and the beginning of Spring usher in a season of hope and renewal; it is a time to reflect on our responsibilities to each other along with our commitments to our faith. The story of Exodus teaches us that even when all hope seems lost, courage and perseverance will enlighten the path to a better tomorrow. From my family to yours, Chag Sameach.

The new Robert A. Pascal Youth & Family Services and Gaudenzia "stabilization center" opening at the end of the month in Crownsville represents a new innovative approach to tackle the opioid crisis by focusing on addiction treatment and cutting down on unnecessary emergency room visits. After more than 300 people overdosed in the County in the first 4 months of the year, this new facility could be a game-changer and a model for the state

After a series of investigations exposed deep flaws in relied upon forensic testing practices, the Obama Administration formed this nonpartisan Commission to improve the scientific soundness and reliability of forensic science. Disbanding it undermines our criminal justice system.   We should be using the most accurate, transparent and accountable practices to solve and prove crimes - otherwise how can we be confident are reaching the correct conclusions and convicting the right people?

Today marks 100 days since I was sworn in to serve the residents of Maryland's Fourth Congressional District. While it has been a very busy start to the 115th Congress, my resolve to keep fighting for our values has never been stronger. But I continue to believe that the only way we can defend our progress or bring about change is if ordinary people come together and get more involved and more engaged in our democracy.

Nothing has a more powerful impact on me than hearing from my constituents. These conversations guide the decisions I make as I introduce legislation, take votes and strive to serve. Meeting and listening to you over the last 100 days has left me me more energized and determined to keep fighting

My office received our first submission for the 2017 Congressional Art Competition! The Competition is an opportunity to recognize and encourage artistic talent and is open to all high school students in my district. The winning artwork will be displayed in the U.S. Capitol  Interested students can submit artwork until April 30th. For more information please visit: https://anthonybrown.house.gov/services/art-competition

Metro's next phase of SafeTrack started today and will impact the Green Line. The Greenbelt station will be closed until May 14 and the College Park station will reopen on April 30. While there will be limited shuttle buses from closed stations, I would recommend making alternative plans to park and commute for the next month.   More information can be found here: https://www.wmata.com/service/status/details/Surge-14.cfm

Today, we celebrate Easter - a time of reinvigoration, forgiveness, and love. We acknowledge the sacrifice Jesus Christ made for us by holding our families close and loving our neighbors as ourselves. Let this day offer renewed hope as we confront the challenges that lie ahead. Happy Easter to everyone, from my family to yours.

I'll be holding my 9th townhall on Saturday at Laurel Branch Library. As I prepare to return to Capitol Hill next week, there are a number of issues we must tackle: preventing a government shutdown, demanding a comprehensive strategy in Syria, renewing calls for an independent commission to investigate Russian interference in our democracy, and stopping Donald Trump and Paul Ryan from taking health care away from millions.

This week I returned from a bipartisan visit to Afghanistan, the United Arab Emirates, Kuwait and Jordan. This trip was an important opportunity to conduct oversight of the policy and resource constraints associated with our ongoing military operations Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Yemen.   The United States must shape an effective, meaningful and workable strategy for our military interventions that justifies the risk to those we send into harm’s way, and proves the effort deserves the continuing support from Congress and the American people. No strategy in the Middle East can ignore Syria - either as a sanctuary for extremism or a deteriorating humanitarian crisis – but the President must come before Congress for the authority to expand military operations and present clear objectives and a path forward.  I was also able to visit the brave men and women – including many Marylanders - who are deployed in the region. I am proud of their service and I’m committed to ensuring they have the equipment, training and leadership to accomplish the mission.

I am impressed by the world-class scientific research done at NASA Goddard, which increases our understanding of the Earth and tries to answer some of our universe’s greatest questions. Goddard employees have demonstrated a commitment to innovate and develop cutting-edge solutions and foster public-private partnerships. These breakthroughs stimulate economic growth and enhance education and workforce development opportunities. While I strongly supported the bipartisan NASA Transition Authorization Act that was signed into law, I am troubled that the Trump Administration’s budget proposal would cut key Goddard activities in earth science, heliophysics and planetary science that allow us to better study the environment, model climate change and mitigate potential negative impacts on modern society. I will fight to restore these funds.  Goddard is continuously advancing STEM education and strengthening the workforce pipeline in Maryland. Almost 100 area students participate in intensive internships conducting hands-on research and engineering. Local students are paired with a NASA mentor to prepare and motivate them. NASA Goddard also partners with local high schools - including Duval, North County and South River - to support STEM curriculum, encourage women and minorities to pursue careers in technology and science, and provide professional development for teachers.  NASA Goddard is a keystone institution in our region, and I will continue to support their mission in Congress

A big thank you to residents and community leaders who joined me to officially open our flagship District Office in Largo. Nothing is more important to me than constituent service - and it all starts with this office. If you're a veteran who needs help navigating the VA, a mom having trouble getting food stamps, a senior who never got their Social Security check, or a family needing new passports - our team will be your advocate and help you navigate government agencies and address your problems.

President Trump loves the cameras and goes to great lengths to craft positive photo ops. While creating visuals is easy, governing, however, is a lot more difficult. This is true of the President's misguided hiring freeze - which hurt our veterans, seniors and many vulnerable communities that rely on public services. There's a lot we can do to achieve a more accountable, more effective and more efficient government - but this isn't it.   As we approach yet another government shut down - check out and share my full op-ed:

On #EarthDay, we pause to celebrate the land we live on, the water we drink, and the air we breathe. We all share these resources, and depend on them to survive and thrive. But such cornerstones of our daily lives deserve our respect, and our best efforts to preserve them. That means utilizing clean forms of energy, protecting ecosystems, and aggressively combating climate change.   However, President Trump and his administration have not only waged war on environmental protections, but also science and research since his first day in office. But I remain hopeful as I watch millions of people around the world March for Science - championing the role of science in advancing the common good. Only by standing together and speaking out can we reject attempts to silence and censor scientific discovery, disregard research and facts, and defund critical agencies like the EPA and NIH.

This weekend, I joined Path to Greatness​ and the Alice Ferguson Foundation to pick up trash and litter in the Potomac watershed. I'm committed to making the places we live, work and play healthy and clean.

The gaming and casino industry has assisted in the creation of more than 4,000 jobs in Prince George’s County since the beginning of MGM’s construction in 2014. With nearly half of those hires coming from within the county itself, the industry has helped revitalize the National Harbor and grow our local economy. By partnering with local businesses and organizations, MGM National Harbor has fostered relationships that will hopefully enhance prosperity for years to come.

Congratulations to my District Director Nichelle Schoultz for being named one of Maryland's Top 100 Women by The Daily Record. Nichelle is a true public servant and an invaluable member of my team. Everyday she works to make government work better for Maryland families - often at great personal sacrifice and without the recognition she deserves. I could not be successful serving the constituents of the Fourth District without her hard work, dedication, and tenacity.

House Republicans weren't satisfied with eliminating health care from 24 million Americans, and now want to gut the #ACA's protections for people with pre-existing conditions. Under the GOP's new plan, health care would become prohibitively expensive for those who need it most. People living with diabetes would face a markup of nearly $5,000, while those with cancer would face premiums tens of thousands of dollars higher. People simply wouldn't be able to afford the care they need.  Republicans are rushing to pass #TrumpCare 2.0 as early as this Friday. Unbelievable

Donald Trump continues to deny, stonewall, and make wild counter-accusations - but #Russia continues to loom over his presidency. Just this week the House Oversight Committee declared that Michael Flynn probably violated federal law, the Senate confirmed Marylander Rod Rosenstein to lead the investigation of Russian ties to the Trump campaign, and the Senate Intelligence Committee hired two more investigators to look into Russian hacking. Congress can't let up.   It is time for Trump to come clean on ties to Russia.

Trump promised to “Make America Great Again” – but no one in America or the Administration seems to know what that means. Where is his plan to defeat ISIS? Where is his infrastructure plan to create millions of jobs? Where is his plan to provide affordable child care? They're missing.

Trump's first 100 days have been volatile and deceitful. He's broken his promises to defeat ISIS, repair our crumbling infrastructure and to create jobs. His proposed healthcare plan would've cost 24 million people their care and removed protections for those with pre-existing conditions. Trump's 1 page "tax plan," is nothing but a massive tax cut for the wealthiest people in our country. He continues to lie about his Russian ties, refuses to release his tax returns and unethically profit from his business empire.   That being said, I am hearted by the energy I'm witnessing in my town halls and others across the country. Political participation is a pillar of our democracy, and Democrats across the United States are winning those fights. Indeed, the President's first 100 days have indeed been disastrous. Sad! However, my commitment to a prosperous, vibrant American that works for all people has never been stronger

When the Congressional Black Caucus and I met with the President last month, Pell Grants were one of my top priorities. Pell Grants provide billions to African-American students each year and without it hundreds of thousands of young people would not be able to afford college. The budget deal restores year-round Pell Grants and increases the maximum grant to $5,920. This will help students graduate on-time and with less debt.

There is nothing "good" about a government shutdown. Not only would it be devastating to the 130,000 federal employees in Maryland, but it would halt critical programs and services millions of American rely on: lifesaving medical research, health and safety inspections, and Social Security and veterans benefits.  Why is President Trump advocating for a shutdown of his own government? Mind-boggling

I spoke and voted against the "Working Families Flexibility Act" - a bill that would hurt, not help working families by taking away the hard-earned overtime pay that many of them rely on to make ends. Congress should be strengthening protections for workers, not gutting them.

Despite Trump's priorities or demands, the budget deal we're voting on today is a big win for Maryland families. NIH and NASA see a boost, Chesapeake Bay cleanup is fully funded, investments in Metro and the Purple Line are continued, Planned Parenthood is untouched, and our troops get a pay raise.

I'm strongly opposed to the so called "American Health Care Act." It's an assault on seniors, it's an offense to working families and it's a life and death decision for the 326,000 people in my district with pre-existing conditions. This bill is trail of broken promises. Trump promised not to cut Medicaid. He promised insurance for everyone. He promised pre-existing conditions would be covered. Broken. Broken. Broken.  I won't vote to gut Medicaid. I won't vote to uninsure 24 million Americans. I'm resisting. I will vote to #KillTheBill

This is a shameful day for the House. The GOP burned the midnight oil and horse-traded behind closed doors to rush this bill to the floor to blindly fulfill a campaign promise and give this inept Administration a desperately needed political victory. But this bill is a disgrace. We are kicking 24 million Americans off their health insurance; increasing costs for veterans, seniors and middle class families; ending Medicaid as we know it; and eliminating protections for 326,000 people in Maryland’s Fourth District with pre-existing conditions. No matter how many band-aids the GOP puts on TrumpCare, we are now forcing Americans - who might get sick or ever need our healthcare system - to fend for themselves while we give the wealthy a huge tax cut.   Health care is a right. Despite today’s vote, I will not give up and I will not give in. I will keep fighting every day for the sick, for our seniors, for women and for working families. I urge the Senate to reject this bill, and work in a bipartisan fashion to actually lower costs and increase coverage for more Americans.

Former President Obama accepted the Profile In Courage Award at the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum on Sunday night, and had some pointed words for Republicans as they forge ahead with plans to dismantle the Affordable Care Act: "I hope that current members of Congress recall that it actually doesn't take a lot of courage to aid those who are already powerful, already comfortable, already influential. But it does require some courage to champion the vulnerable and the sick and the infirm"

The termination of FBI Director James Comey is highly troubling at best, or Nixonian at worst, given that the Director was leading the ongoing investigation into the ties between the Russian government and Trump campaign, and Russian efforts to undermine our democracy. I renew my call for a special counsel and independent commission to fully and impartially investigate Russian interference in our elections. Nothing less will restore trust in our justice system.

I joined thousands in front of the White House to protest against Trump's xenophobic and ineffective immigration policies. Immigrants built this country. As Americans we stand up for immigrants because we know that our parents or grandparents or great grandparents were immigrants too, and that America only grows stronger with every new person who comes here seeking more opportunity and a better life

I joined thousands in front of the White House to protest against Trump's xenophobic and ineffective immigration policies. Immigrants built this country. As Americans we stand up for immigrants because we know that our parents or grandparents or great grandparents were immigrants too, and that America only grows stronger with every new person who comes here seeking more opportunity and a better life

Trump is setting up this commission in an attempt to support his bogus claims that millions of people voted illegally in November. This is nothing but a distraction and a complete waste of taxpayer money. Voter fraud is essentially non-existent. We should be working to restore the Voting Rights Act, attacking voter suppression and removing barriers to voting that Republicans have erected across the country

Attorney General Sessions continues to roll-back the progress we made under President Obama. He's returning to mass incarceration policies for nonviolent drug offenders and has shown disdain for consent decrees that tackle unconstitutional policing practices across the country.   I addressed this issue in an op-ed this week. These decrees work, and are critical to reform police departments in places like Baltimore and Chicago. Sessions should not stop the changes that will restore trust between police and the communities they serve.

Whether it’s biological or adoptive moms, grandmothers, aunts, or a mentor – today, we reflect on just how hard they work every day, many times without the appreciation they truly deserve. Whether you have a single mom working two or three jobs to make ends meet, or your mom is an immigrant like mine who sacrificed so much to provide their children more opportunity, they all deserve the love and respect we could ever give them.   Today, let’s not only commit to be better family members, but also strengthen our resolve in the fight for equality, paid parental leave, high quality health and child care, affordable college, flexibility at work, and increasing the minimum wage.   Happy Mother’s Day!

As a nation we depend on law enforcement to keep our neighborhoods safe. These officers often make tremendous sacrifices and put their lives on the line to protect ours. Today on Peace Officers Memorial Day, we honor the fallen heroes whose selfless acts have left behind safer streets and stronger communities.

The next phase of SafeTrack will start tomorrow with significant impacts to the Orange Line. From May 16th to June 15th, the New Carrollton, Landover, Cheverly, Deanwood, and Minnesota Avenue stations will be closed. Orange Line trains will continue to run every 6 to 8 minutes, and Silver Line trains will operate from only Wiehle-Reston East to Stadium Armory every 12 minutes. Shuttles will run from New Carrollton to Stadium-Armory every 30 minutes, and shuttles will also operate between the closed Orange Line stations and open Blue Line Stations. Unfortunately, Prince George’s residents will be hit the hardest from the closure, and you should expect longer lines and bigger crowds at shuttle stops and Metro stations. Be sure to utilize alternative forms of transportation like ride sharing, buses, or the MARC Penn Line from New Carrollton to Union Station.   Check out this link for more details: http://wamu.org/story/17/05/15/safetrack-moves-orange-line-prince-georges-county/

I am extremely disturbed by reports that President Trump revealed highly classified information regarding the fight against the Islamic State to senior Russian officials. When Russian interests in Syria and elsewhere are opposed to our own, this reckless disclosure endangers our troops, our intelligence community, our allies, and our national security. This is unacceptable and alarming.   President Trump either does not understand the grave implications of his behavior or is callously indifferent to its consequences, and this latest revelation only adds further questions that need to be answered about his relationship with Russia. The President owes Congress and the American people an explanation.

Local businesses are drivers of job creation and economic growth. Last week, I visited and spoke to employees at UPS - which has 1,200 workers in the Fourth Congressional District, Phoenix International Holdings, Inc. the world's premier underwater service provider, minority-owned small business Zip Mailing, and workforce development non-profit The Training Source, Inc.  I'll keep working to invest in Maryland businesses, create good-paying jobs position our prepare workers to compete in the global economy.
This is obstruction of justice. High crimes and misdemeanors. The President is not above the law

Trump firing Comey while he was leading the investigating into Michael Flynn and Russian interference into our elections was wrong. The President should not be able to fire the FBI Director for political or personal reasons. That's why I introduced the 'Fighting for Intelligent, Rational, and Ethical Dismissal Act" of FIRED Act - to raise the standard the President must meet before dismissing the FBI Director.   Congress cannot be a rubber stamp for this Administration and we must uphold our constitutional responsibility to hold this President accountable.

Deputy Attorney General Rosenstein made the right choice to appoint a Special Counsel to investigate and if warranted, prosecute crimes related to Russian interference in our elections. This is a positive development and I trust that the process will follow the facts. Special Counsel Robert Mueller must now have the resources to conduct a complete and thorough investigation. He should be shielded from any political pressure exerted by President Trump, Attorney General Sessions, or any other person who would seek to interfere in the investigative process.   However, this appointment does not diminish the need for an independent commission. The American people deserve answers and the truth regarding Russian meddling in our democracy and the President's ties to Russia.

We need to be certain the FBI Director can perform his or her duties free from threats from the Oval Office or partisan politics. I introduced the FIRED Act to prevent the President from firing the FBI Director without good cause. If the FIRED Act were in place, Mr. Comey would still be leading the FBI investigation into Michael Flynn and Trump's ties to Russia

Last night I joined Bruce Johnson on WUSA 9 to discuss the Special Counsel and the ongoing Trump-Russia investigation. It is disgraceful that Trump is trying to discredit the process to seek the truth. We must follow the facts and get answers for the American people

As we near the end of Police Week, I want to commemorate the 36 heroes from Anne Arundel and Prince George's Counties  who have made the ultimate sacrifice while protecting their communities. Enough cannot be said for these brave men and women who wear the badge and keep us safe every day.

As a retired U.S. Army Reserve Colonel, I understand the challenges our servicemen and women face at home and abroad. All too often they put their lives on the line overseas, but don’t receive the support they deserve when they get back. So today, take time to say thank you to the members of the armed services in your life, and acknowledge the sacrifices they have made for all of us

The murder of the Bowie University student in College Park early this morning is a tragedy. My condolences go to the young man's family and friends, and to the entire Bowie State University and University of Maryland communities. Each of us deserves to be safe wherever we are, and this mindless act of violence is truly horrific. Let us come together in our grief and pray for justice and love as we remember the loss of this young man.

Richard Collins III was a second lieutenant in the US Army. After graduation, he was going follow in the footsteps of his father - a military veteran, and commit his life to serving our country. But his future was cruelly stolen and our hearts broken by a neo-nazi who was a member of the "Alt Reich Nation." This is a despicable and terrible crime of hate

Cruel. There is no other word to describe Trump's budget. He eviscerates aid for the working poor - cutting Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance by $880 billion and slashing food stamps, school lunches, Meals on Wheels and Habitat for Humanity.

I spoke on the floor about the life and death of Lieutenant Richard W. Collins III. His death was not some random act of violence. It was a heinous, despicable and unprovoked crime of hate. His murderer was a member of a racist neo-nazi hate group. But his murder was not an isolated incident. Nationally, there’s been an unprecedented spike in racist and hate activity on campuses since November.  This escalation of hate is not going to stop unless we take a stand - against the radical right and hate festering on campus, and against leaders that have been too content to remain silent and look the other way. Hate speech is not protected. Encouraging open dialogue cannot lead to inaction that creates a breeding ground for prejudice, discrimination and violent hatred. Richard Collins deserved better. Our children deserve better

Today we remember and honor the brave men and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice defending our country. #MemorialDay. I thought I would do that by spending time with the patriotic Soldiers of the 29th Military Police Company of the Maryland National Guard who today are on rotation and making us proud in the Mojave Desert at the National Training Center/Fort Irwin, California.

10 days after Richard Collins was murdered by a domestic terrorist, only deafening silence from Trump and the White House. We cannot sit idly by and ignore this surge in white supremacist racist activism

I'm holding my 15th town hall in the Port Towns this Saturday. President Trump and Congressional Republicans have an aggressive agenda this summer - adopting a budget, raising the debt limit, avoiding a government shutdown, passing tax reform and repealing the Affordable Care Act - and I want to hear from you.

President Trump’s exit from the #ParisClimateAgreement is a generational setback. His decision has effectively pushed the climate fight onto our children - a point that might be too late. Instead of embracing innovation and clean energy jobs, the President has elected to remain ignorant to the needs of the 21st century economy. Neglecting climate change is an environmental risk, an economic pitfall and a national security threat.   Today, President Trump has ensured the United States will no longer be a climate leader, and will fall behind to countries like China and Germany who continue to forge ahead. Our children and our children’s children will incredulously look back on the incompetence of a Presidential Administration that has chosen willful ignorance over American leadership.

Earlier this week, I met with domestic violence survivors and advocates to discuss what Congress can do to expand protections for abuse victims. My family personally confronted the horrors of domestic violence when my cousin Cathy was shot and killed by her estranged boyfriend. While we made progress in Maryland reducing domestic violence with the passage Cathy’s Law and other initiatives, we must now expand and strengthen domestic violence protections nationally. That's why I introduced the Protecting Domestic Violence and Stalking Victims Act that will prevent domestic abusers from buying firearms, expand protections for dating couples and tackle the problem with stalking.    I want to personally thank the Maryland Network Against Domestic Violence, The National Network to End Domestic Violence, AG Frosh and so many other organizations and advocates for joining me in this effort and for the work they do to get us closer to ending domestic violence in our communities.

Trump has been President for 133 days and has yet to put forward a single bill that would create jobs or jump-start the economy. Unlike the President, I will not wait.   Today, I’m introducing the 21st Century Investment Act of 2017 to incentivize companies to research and manufacture here in the United States. For every dollar spent in the manufacturing sector it adds another $1.37 to the economy, and each job in manufacturing creates 2.5 jobs in local goods and services. This bill would be good for our nation’s businesses and will create jobs for hard working Americans.

Last week I had the chance to tour Thompson Creek Window Company and sit down for a roundtable discussion with local business leaders. There I met hard-working, creative innovators who spoke on their experience and their ability to grow and hire more people. From bakeries to coffeehouses, from window makers to researchers, local businesses are truly the backbone of our economy. And we need to ensure American workers and our small businesses are in positions to expand and thrive. That's why I introduced the 21st Century Investment Act to make sure companies like Thompson Creek can easily manufacture and create new products here in the United States that boost economic growth, create jobs and encourage local investment.

With meager legislative accomplishments so far, President Trump and Congressional Republicans are planning to aggressively push their agenda forward this month. That's why its important I hear from you this Saturday at my 16th town hall at Largo-Kettering Branch library.  Are there any Republican initiatives that the American people are behind? If there are, I haven't found them yet.

We have a lot of work to do here in Congress. We need smart economic growth; we need to protect our right to affordable healthcare; we need to preserve our environment; and we need to hold the Trump Administration accountable. The President has proposed drastic cuts to important federal programs like social security, and is threatening to strip healthcare from 24 million Americans.   While the first 6 months have been busy, I’m committed to fighting for affordable healthcare, expanding the middle class and creating good-paying American jobs.

Former FBI Director James Comey’s testimony exposed that President Trump repeatedly tried to influence the FBI’s investigation into Michael Flynn’s ties with Russia, and fired Mr. Comey for failing to bend to his wishes. The FBI must remain independent from the partisan and personal whims of any President, including President Trump.  The FBI must be free to carry out its mission in the most effective way possible and follow the facts wherever they lead.    In addition to special counsel Robert Mueller’s work, Congress must be relentless in our effort to discover all of the facts related to Russian interference in US elections. Providing a full accounting to the American people of what happened is the important first step to prevent any country from interfering in our democracy again.

Nobody should want to return to a system that produced a historic financial crisis that ruined communities and damaged so many lives. But that's exactly what the GOP's so-called CHOICE Act does.  It once again gives Wall Street permission to swindle working families and destroys the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau - a strong consumer watchdog that protects our veterans and military families, supports our underserved communities and helps our financial system work better for all Americans.   That's why I voted against this bill and I'm determined to fight efforts of Trump and the GOP to roll back Wall Street reform. It is extremely harmful for seniors, small businesses and and hardworking Americans across the country.

105 people in Anne Arundel County have died from heroin-related causes this year. That makes it the third highest county in the state of Maryland. As drug addiction continues to ravage our communities, we need to do everything we can to address this growing epidemic. Pascal Crisis Stabilization Center is working to expand options and access to treatment so patients don’t have to wait in line at emergency rooms. We need an “all of the above” style approach to addiction and I thank both the staff at Pascal and those that made this facility a reality.

During Speaker Paul Ryan’s press conference yesterday, he stated that the FBI and White House should be independent from each other. Mr. Speaker, I couldn’t agree more. No matter who is President or how “new” he or she may be to public service, the FBI should be free from the impulses of the Oval Office.   That’s why I introduced the FIRED Act last month to guarantee the director of the FBI cannot be fired without reasonable cause. The American people deserve a full account of how the 2016 election was influenced by outside forces, and we need to ensure the FBI can conduct a thorough investigation to the utmost extent.

While June offers a time to celebrate the accomplishments of those who marched before us, we must double down on our efforts and stand with our lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender communities across the country. From Harvey Milk to the Stonewall riots, from the Marriage Equality ruling to Orlando, we must never yield in the fight for safety and equality under the law.  So if you're marching in the #EqualityMarch2017 – do it with pride! Happy #Pride2017 everyone

The Lovings weren’t natural revolutionaries but they became trailblazers for millions of couples, including my parents, who simply wanted to love and marry the person they wanted. Their battle, their courage and their devotion is an American treasure. #LovingDay
Congratulations to Prince George’s own Kevin Durant for leading the Warriors to the title! MVP on the court and in the community.

President Trump has requested $639 billion for the Pentagon - saying the extra money is needed to rebuild the military. While I support improving the U.S. military's readiness for combat, Congress cannot blindly deliver funding for new weapons and gear without a comprehensive national security strategy that addresses ISIS, Afghanistan, Russian aggression, North Korea and emerging future threats. I also remain deeply troubled by the 30% cut to the State Department and USAID. Diplomacy and defense are both key components of our national security.

It’s not about which side of the aisle you’re on, or whether you’re a Senator or member of the House of Representatives, we come to Congress and dedicate ourselves to public service to make the world a better place for all people. On somber days like today, we cannot allow this attack on our democracy to drive a deeper wedge between us. Instead, we must extend our hands to our neighbors and remind them that we are all Americans, we are all on the same team.

My grandmother came to this country as a domestic worker, without proper documentation. She did this so that my father could become the first member of our family to go to college. He became a doctor and dedicated himself to serving those most in need in some of the poorest neighborhoods.   That's why I strongly support #DACA. Each of us is strengthened when all of us succeed, and we all suffer when members of our communities are kept from reaching their potential. Since 2012, the 1.6 million young people granted DACA have been able to go to college, contribute to their community and reach for their dreams.   DACA is clearly working and it needs to stay

#FlashbackFriday to my bipartisan congressional trip to the National Training Center/Fort Irwin in California last month. At approximately the size of Rhode Island, the NTC is the premier training facility for U.S. troops before they are deployed. Soldiers spend a 21-day rotation there conducting real-life simulations that prepares them for war. These rotations are intense and require our soldiers to work with military units across the Unites States and the world. Thank you to 29th Military Police Company of the Maryland National Guard at the NTC and all service members on the front-lines who dedicate their lives to our country.

The United States is a global super power and needs to lead like one. Climate change remains a threat to our national security, economy and our environment – if we don’t address it now that threat only becomes worse. The withdrawal from the #ParisAgreement is both a refusal to lead and a refusal to act on one of the most pressing issues of our time.

Two years ago, nine people were gunned down as they stood for prayer with their eyes closed at the Mother Emanuel Church in Charleston. Not only was this done in a church, a place of sanctuary, activism and safety, but this horrific act of violence – this act of domestic terrorism – was motivated by hate and malice and specifically targeted the African American community. While the community and the entire country felt the weight of this event, we will never allow it to break or tarnish our resolve. We must not slip into a comfortable silence or settle for symbolic gestures. We must remain committed to fighting for justice and rooting out hate and prejudice every day
Being a dad is one of the most important jobs a man can have and few things can bring as much joy as the blessings of fatherhood on #FathersDay
On #Juneteenth we commemorate the end of slavery in the United States and rededicate ourselves to the fight for equality

Today I join nearly 200 of my colleagues in Congress to hold the President accountable. Contrary to what President Trump might believe, no one is above the law and I will stand for Congress’ right to review the President’s foreign transactions. The American people deserve the truth and a President that isn’t using the Oval Office to pad his wallet or stack his bank account. Plain and simple, Trump is in clear violation of the Constitution and we need to ensure he complies with the law just like everyone else.

On Saturday, I'm hosting my first bilingual town hall meeting at the Langley Park Community Center. I'm committed to bringing everyone to the table and language will not be barrier. We have a lot to discuss - immigration, health care, and President Trump - so I hope to see you there!   El sábado, estaré participando en mi primer foro bilingüe en el Centro Comunitario de Langley Park. Quiero escucharte y contestar tus preguntas, y el lenguaje no será una barrera. Tenemos mucho que discutir - la inmigración, la atención de la salud, y el Presidente Trump - así que esperamos verlos allí!

As an executive member of the Congressional Black Caucus, I urge the The United States Department of Justice, Department of Homeland Security and the FBI to dedicate more resources to investigating and prosecuting hate crimes to the utmost extent. We lost Lt. Richard W. Collins III not out of a random act of violence, but rather a calculated act of racial hatred. There’s been a documented spike in racist and hate-based activity on our college campuses since November, and we cannot allow that to go unnoticed. Lt. Collins deserved better; all our children deserve better.   While the Constitution guarantees all people the rights of the First Amendment, it does not give hate speech and racially-charged animosity a free pass. Instead, we need to confront the growing violence and acts of domestic terrorism that has plagued our communities for far too long.   Read the CBC’s full letter here: http://bit.ly/2sr4aGR

When Congressional Black Caucus’ leadership initially met with President Trump, we presented him with a 130-page policy document detailing our agenda and concerns. To this day,  the Administration has not responded to a single proposal or followed through on the promises the President made to us.    In fact, since taking office, President Trump has proposed massive cuts to education, Medicaid and other programs important to African American families. Along with pushing to take health coverage away from 24 million people, Trump declared HBCU funding was unconstitutional, and resurrected a failed war on drugs that has led to a mass incarceration crisis. It is clear to me that Trump has no intention of acting on anything we discussed during our meeting in March.   I will not be and the CBC should not be a prop for an Administration that is willfully ignoring the real issues impacting our communities. I strongly voted against going to a photo-op meeting with Trump

To push back against Russian meddling in our democracy and elections around the world, I am cosponsoring the Fostering Unity Against Russian Aggression Act of 2017 with 22 of my congressional colleagues. Congress must lead if Trump remains silent on this issue. Instead of sitting idly by, this bill calls for a comprehensive strategy to address Russian aggression - in Europe, in the Middle East, in cyberspace - while working to deescalate a conflict that would be catastrophic for all.   Read the full press release here: http://bit.ly/2sF8dxy

What right appears most often in the Constitution? It's "the right to vote." But 2016 was the first year we elected a president without the full protections of the Voting Rights Act. What happened? More voter ID laws, restrictions on voter registration and early voting, and fewer polling places. This depressed turnout especially in poor neighborhoods and communities of color. That's why I strongly support restoring and modernizing the Voting Rights Act.   The Founders in Philadelphia, the women at Seneca Falls and the marchers in Selma all understood the power of the vote. We strengthen our democracy when we protect the right of fellow voters to make their choices, whatever they may be. We cannot wait until the next election. We must act now. #RestoreVRA #RestoreTheVOTE

Congratulations to Prince George's native son and DeMatha Hoops alum Markelle Fultz #20 for being selected #1 in the #NBADraft yesterday. He joins other Prince George's greats who were top draft picks - Len Bias, Danny Ferry, Steve Francis, Kevin Durant, Michael Beasley and Victor Oladipo  Prince George's County is truly the talent epicenter for the NBA!

As President Trump and House Republicans consider malicious immigration restrictions next week, I will be holding a bilingual town hall tomorrow to hear your concerns on the Administration’s heartless crackdown on immigrant and refugee communities. The United States is a nation of people who came here in search of safety and a better life. We must not turn our backs on them. When we stand with our neighbors, we all become stronger

Maryland became the first state in the nation to pass marriage equality and successfully defend it at the ballot box in 2013. The rest of the nation followed with the landmark gay marriage equality ruling, Obergefell v. Hodges in 2015. Granting same-sex couples the Constitutional right to marry, the ruling was the result of generations-worth of activism, protest and courage.   This month is not only a celebration and reflection of how far we can reach, but also a testament to how far we still must go. As we know, the fight for true equality for all people is far from over. And while we may live in uncertain times, we can rely on one simple fact: Love always wins #PrideMonth

3,800 Maryland veterans stand to lose their Medicaid coverage because of #TrumpCare. That’s 3,800 too many.   All too often our veterans come home and don’t receive the support they have earned and deserve. Those who are willing to lay down their lives for the United States of America should not be cut from their health care coverage under any circumstance http://ampr.gs/2sv8ViD

After weeks of secretive behind-closed-doors plotting, Senate Republicans have proposed increasing the number of Americans without health insurance by 22 million.   Heartless and mean, this bill - just like the version passed by the GOP House - takes a meat cleaver to protections for those with preexisting conditions, cuts Medicaid for millions of children, seniors and people with disabilities, and eliminates maternity care and mental health coverage. It will force middle class families to pay more for less care, cause out-of-pocket costs to soar, and make health insurance simply unaffordable for millions of working families in order to finance a massive tax cut for the wealthy.   We must stop #TrumpCare

Plain and simple, #TrumpCare would be a disaster for the health of Americans and our economy. In Maryland, Medicaid covers 25% of children, 40% of people with disabilities and 60% of nursing home residents. All stand to lose the care they need.   Just like the House bill, the Senate’s bill will drive up costs for less coverage, and would force older folks to pay thousands of dollars more for their care while giving the mega rich a huge tax cut. By ending Medicaid as we know it, gutting protections for those with preexisting conditions and eliminating access to preventive care, prescription drug coverage – veterans will suffer, children will suffer, women will suffer and our seniors will suffer.   TrumpCare is unacceptable and I will do everything I can to oppose this bill

I’ve held 17 town halls since coming to Congress in January and last Saturday’s was my first that was bilingual. Connecting with the people who sent me to Washington, whether they’re black, white, Hispanic, Asian, English-speaking or non-English speaking, will always be my top priority. Especially as the Trump Administration continues to carry out cruel immigration crackdowns, the voices of all my constituents should be heard and their concerns noticed. Diversity and inclusion drives our economy and makes our communities stronger – when we make room for all people, we all prosper.

The Trump Administration is continuing its all-out assault on our wetlands, streams and natural resources. Maryland depends on the Clean Water Rule to support Chesapeake Bay clean-up efforts and ensure Bay headwaters, like the Potomac River remain healthy. President Trump now puts millions of Maryland’s stream miles and millions of acres of wetlands at risk from pollution and destruction.    67 percent of Marylanders receive their drinking water from waters under the protection of this rule. It is the EPA’s job to ensure the country’s wetlands, waterways and tributaries remain clean and usable. The Administration’s choice to roll back the Water Rule not only undercuts their responsibility to the American people, but also endangers Maryland’s economy, environment and the millions of people who depend on clean water every day

GOP may have delayed a vote on #TrumpCare, but our fight is far from over. Their quest to end Medicaid as we know it would hurt families across our country, but its particularly heinous when Republicans target special-education students and health services for kids living in poverty

Even the Pentagon’s top military and civilian officials have stated that climate change is a direct threat to the security of the United States. According to a report from the National Academy of Sciences, a three-foot rise in sea levels will threaten the operations of more than 128 U.S. military sites.  As we work to pass the #FY18NDAA to fund our national security apparatus, we need to ensure that climate change is plays a role in our comprehensive strategic vision. That's why I supported Congressman Jim Langevin’s amendment to ensure the Defense Department considers factors like climate change and climate resilience to safeguard ourselves from the threats of the 21st century

Today I spoke on the House floor against the GOP's anti-immigrant bill that will break up families and undercut local law enforcement.
