Our hearts and prayers go out to the families and loved ones of the two Maryland sailors who were killed in the #USSJohnSMcCain collision that claimed 10 American lives near Singapore this week. Timothy Thomas Eckels Jr. of Manchester and Kevin Sayer Bushell of Gaithersburg were dedicated members of our Armed Services and will be remembered for their courage and commitment to their country. The lives of these young men were claimed much too soon

The Home Depot is not only one of the largest employers in Maryland’s Fourth District, but they also help team members prepare for their next career steps through their “myOrangeLadder” program. While providing them with achievable growth opportunities, Home Depot works with their employees to develop career objectives and interview skills.   Companies like Home Depot must continue to empower and invest in their workers so that we can give all Americans #ABetterDeal. Thank you for the wonderful tour – it was a pleasure to meet so many hard working Marylanders.
For true equality, working women need paid sick days, paid family leave & affordable, quality child care. #WomensEqualityDay

Thanks to Prince George’s County native Lindsay Allen, the New York Liberty is one of the best teams in the #WBNA this year.   Great work Lindsay – you’re one the strongest players in basketball because of your hard work, dedication and tenacity on the court.

#SheriffArpaio was found guilty of civil rights abuses and people died in his desolate "tent cities" where they were kept illegally. This is a gross misuse of power and the President can't erase human rights abuses. Sheriff Arpaio belongs in prison.

Stretching back to my earliest months in Annapolis to my time in Congress right now, I have remained committed to moving the #PurpleLine forward. And today, after years of delay and repeated attempts to derail this project – we broke ground on the critical 16-mile light rail line that will create a more closely integrated Maryland.   The groundbreaking of this project represents a monumental step forward for catalyzing economic development, revitalizing communities, developing pathways to opportunity for hard-working Marylanders, and above all, creating good-paying, family sustaining jobs. Using an innovative public-private partnership, the Purple Line leverages private-sector investment and expertise to lower costs for taxpayers while maintaining our commitment to maximize participation by minority-owned businesses, guarantee fair competition for highly skilled workers, and ensure sound environmental protections.

Yesterday we broke ground on a project that will generate millions of dollars in economic development, create thousands of jobs, and reinvigorate neighborhoods. The track of the #PurpleLine will lead to the exact kind of inclusive growth communities in #Maryland need right now.   This project should be a model for the rest of the country as we look for new, balanced approaches to confront growing infrastructure challenges. It’s time for Congress and the Administration to step up, and work in a bipartisan way to pass a well-funded #infrastructure package that meets the needs of the National Capital Region and communities across the country.

As a veteran with 30 years of service in the United States Army, I firmly believe that all people, regardless of gender identification, should have the right, privilege and responsibility to participate in the defense of our country. Thousands of #transgender Americans - like Petty Officer Brock Stone - are honorably serving in the military, and I reject any action that diminishes their patriotism, courage and sacrifice. We must push back against this hateful and bigoted agenda and pursue justice for our service members - both in the Courts and in Congress. #TransBan

As we begin another school year, we must address the rising tide of hate that is sweeping across our nation’s college campuses. It is that very tide that has caused various hate-based incidents across the state of Maryland, took Lt. Richard Collins’ life and led to the white nationalist rally in #Charlottesville. Young people are being specifically targeted by a budding alt-right network, and our institutions of higher learning must do their part to ensure campuses do not become breeding grounds of hate.   On Thursday, I will be speaking at the University of Maryland, College Park to discuss race and politics in an increasingly tense time. We can no longer afford to look the other way and pretend these events are isolated or in cold blood. The victims of these tragedies – Lt. Collins, Heather Heyer and many others – deserve better. They deserve our action.   RSVP here: https://securelb.imodules.com/s/1132/form2016.aspx?sid=1132&gid=1&pgid=6051&cid=8739
At 4 PM, I will be speaking at the University of Maryland about racism, rising tide of hate and how we should move forward. If you can't make it, we'll be streaming it here on Facebook
Watch me discuss the emerging national discourse about race, hate/bias incidents, campus climate, and the path forward.

As families across the country gather for cookouts and barbecues, let us never forget the labor leaders who have dedicated their lives to growing the middle class and expanding the #AmericanDream. For decades, unions have helped provide family-sustaining paychecks that have allowed people to buy homes, send their children to school and retire with certainty.   Men and women of all races, ethnicities and backgrounds helped build the United States from the ground up. Today, we celebrate their grit and hard work. It is because of them that the United States is the most prosperous nation on the planet, and millions of Americans can go to work every day knowing the financial future of their family is secure. Happy #LaborDay everyone!

I joined first responders, National Guardsmen, and volunteers from every part of the country in Texas for #HarveyRelief. In times of need, we as Americans stand with each other and look out for each other. That spirit of service and community I saw first hand truly exemplifies what our country is all about.   Those who have been affected by #Harvey face a long road ahead - but they will not travel that path alone. Our entire country will travel it with them. In the coming weeks, I am committed to giving these families the resources they need to rebuild and get back on their feet.

My grandmother came to this country as a domestic worker, without proper documentation. She did this so that my father could become the first member of our family to go to college. He became a doctor and dedicated himself to serving those most in need in some of the poorest neighborhoods in our country.   I strongly support #DACA. Each of us is strengthened when all of us succeed, and we all suffer when members of our communities are kept from reaching their potential. But today, Donald Trump stole the American Dream from hundreds of thousands of Americans who are going to college, serving in the military, contributing to our economy and call our country home. This is a cruel betrayal of our values.  I will continue to forcefully support the #DREAMAct. Congress must swiftly vote on it and send it to the President's desk. It is the right thing to do. #DefendDACA

By ending #DACA the Trump Administration is pulling the rug out from under active service members who are willing to sacrifice their lives for the United States. Because of DACA, thousands of people are now pursuing the #AmericanDream, and many are choosing to do so as a member of the Armed Services. I stand with #Dreamers who are in the military and will fight to defend their right to serve their country. Many Dreamers have devoted their lives to the U.S. military, and we should not ruthlessly kick them out of the county they have vowed to defend.

I will #DefendDACA here in Congress, and work to put the #DREAMAct on the President’s desk as soon as possible. But with the Administration’s recent actions to rescind #DACA, it’s important #Dreamers know what to do in the weeks ahead. To the nearly ten thousand DACA recipients in #Maryland: I am with you. I will continue to do everything I can to protect our young immigrants and keep families together.

Governor Hogan's insistence on blocking additional investments to Metro while suggesting it be privatized is reckless and a giant step backwards. Families depend on Metro every day, especially low-income workers, people with disabilities and seniors – and outsourcing services or privatizing operations will not lead to a safer, more reliable system.        Metro is extremely beneficial to Maryland – cutting congestion, increasing regional economic opportunity, and building connected communities where companies want to locate and families want to live. I'm committed to working with leaders of all political stripes to fix and improve Metro.

Marylanders cannot afford any further can kicking from the Governor on funding for Metro. Hogan has side-stepped this important issue for much too long, and it is time to work toward a solution that works for all people in the D.C.-Maryland region. The Metro system connects communities, gets people to work and school, and drives economic development. For those reasons, Metro is critical to the daily lives of thousands of Marylanders, and deserves the investment to ensure its safety and reliability.

Two Navy destroyer collisions have recently claimed the lives of 17 Americans – among them are three young Marylanders. These tragedies clearly indicate that something is wrong, and we must get to the bottom of these incidents.   It is in the interest of every American to ensure the future safety of our sailors, and guarantee that the Seventh Fleet is mission-ready and can meet our national security needs in a complex, hostile region.

I returned to the USAACE and Fort Rucker in Alabama - where I got my start as a helicopter pilot more than 30 years ago on September 4, 1985. I am so proud of the great work still being done there to train the next generation of aviators.

The Mission of Mercy and Health Equity Festival in College Park will offer free adult dental care Sunday, September 10 at the XFINITY Center all day from 7AM-5PM. If you’re 18 or older, check out the event if you’re experiencing any tooth, gum or jaw problems. Other health services will also be available such as blood pressure, HIV and vision screenings.

The launch of the new #AbilitiesRide program will offer Marylanders with disabilities a more flexible transportation option at a discounted rate without having to share a ride. In addition, riders will not be forced to schedule the ride in advance.   If you trip begins and ends within the state of #Maryland, eligible customers will be able to use a Regency Taxi or Silver Cab for as little as $5.00 to get where they need to go. As we continue to work to make our Metro system accessible to as many people as possible, it is important that we continue to offer a variety of affordable options that allow Marylanders to easily get to work and school.

On the 16th anniversary of the #September11th attacks we remember the nearly 3,000 individuals who lost their lives, and we honor the first responders, fire fighters, and law enforcement officers who unselfishly sacrificed their own safety to save others. And with the memories of those heroes in our hearts, we recommit ourselves to our neighbors and defending true American values against those who want to see us fall. We draw strength from their sacrifice. We endure and America endures. No matter what comes our way, the United States has always come out stronger, and we will continue to come out stronger.

This week, I convened local business leaders to discuss how we can continue to make Prince George’s and Anne Arundel better places for new business and economic development. Whether it is through career and technical education, apprenticeships, community college, or a traditional 4-year college degree, we must supply our workers with the skills and family-sustaining paychecks they need to thrive in the 21st century economy. By incentivizing businesses to invest in their workforce over the long-term, we will knock down barriers to the middle class and get #ABetterDeal for all Marylanders.

For over 80 years, #silencers have been effectively regulated under the #NationalFirearmsAct. Plain and simple, the current law is working and crimes involving silencers are rare. Congressional Republicans are pushing the so-called #HearingProtectionAct to not only remove the requirement that silencers be registered with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms (ATF), but also requires the ATF destroy the existing registry altogether. It limits the ability of states to impose taxes on silencers, and enables these dangerous devises to find their way into the wrong hands.   If Congress is truly concerned about hearing loss from exposure to gunfire – for service members, veterans, police officers and hunters – let’s follow the advice of the National Hearing Conservation and invest in appropriately fitted hearing protection like earplugs and earmuffs.

The new, consolidated U.S. Customs and Immigration Services (USCIS) in Camp Spring will be a transformative project for our community. While the GSA has finally signed the 15-year lease agreement, I will keep working to ensure this project continues to move forward. By generating 3,700 jobs and developing a ladder to the middle class for hard-working Marylanders, #USCIS should be the first of many high-profile successes that puts Prince George’s County on the map.  Read my full op-ed here: https://marylandmatters.org/2017/09/11/guess-commentary-a-game-changer-for-prince-georges-county/

Last weekend, I held my 19th town hall. Since being elected to represent the Fourth District of Maryland, it has remained one of my top priorities to be open and accessible to my constituents. Thank you to all who attended last Saturday – I always appreciate hearing your thoughts, concerns and ideas on how to make our community a better, more prosperous place for all people.

By ending #DACA, President Trump made our immigration system less fair and just for our young people. My grandmother came to this country as a domestic worker without proper documentation. She did this so that my father could become the first member of our family to go to college. He later became a doctor and dedicated himself to working in some of the poorest neighborhoods where I grew up.   Kicking #DREAMers out won’t create jobs, or make our neighborhoods safer. Passing the #DREAMAct is the right thing to do for our economic competitiveness, military readiness, and public safety. Let’s not hold our DREAMers hostage anymore – it’s time to pass the DREAM Act now.

I applaud the recent partnership between Morgan State University and Laurel College Center to bring opportunities to the people of Maryland’s Fourth District. Through this program, we will offer in-demand classes in #engineering and #psychology to students looking to complete their bachelor’s degree after receiving an associate’s degree from either Howard Community College or Prince George's Community College. Located in Prince George’s and bordering Howard and Anne Arundel counties, Laurel College Center is now perfectly positioned to open more doors for the people of #MD04.

I want to make the first two years of #CommunityCollege free for all who are willing to work hard to get ahead. A solid education is the backbone of the #AmericanDream, and we must ensure people have affordable options to continue their studies and learn new skills. Community colleges are pathways to the middle class for millions of young people graduating high school, workers looking to get new skills and #veterans transitioning back to civilian life. In America, a quality education should be a right for everybody willing to work for it.  Read my full press release here: http://bit.ly/2f08zN0

Today, I introduced legislation to remove the #RobertELee statue at #Antietam National Battlefield. Public land should not be home to symbols of hate and bigotry that memorialize leaders of the pro-slavery, traitorous Confederate South. Statues and monuments ought to celebrate the brave individuals who have fought and died for our country and true American values. The statue of Lee commemorates a man that owned and beat African Americans, and fought to preserve the institution of slavery. The statue is historically inaccurate and offensive, and I am looking forward to its timely removal.   Read my release here: http://bit.ly/2jv6R7F

This weekend you can celebrate the 70th Anniversary of the United States Air Force at the 2017 Joint Base Andrews Air Show! I urge all to check out this display of aerial power and acrobatics both Saturday and Sunday, from 9AM – 5PM.

#RichardCollinsIII, #HeatherHeyer and future generations deserve better – they deserve our action. We must not let our college campuses and institutions of higher learning devolve into breeding grounds of bigotry and hate speech.   Instituting zero-tolerance policies for acts of racism on campus and guaranteeing more diverse voices among faculty and staff are critical steps all schools must take to make their campuses a safe place for all students. Diversity and unity is the foundation of our nation, and that can only happen when the country does a better job confronting hate in all forms.

Last week, I toured the Anne Arundel County portion of Maryland’s Fourth Congressional District with County Executive Steve Schuh. We visited key facilities like the Patuxent Research Refuge, U.S. Navy Dairy Farm, and Anne Arundel Community College – where I held my 20th town hall on Saturday.   I promised Anne Arundel County would have a strong advocate and helpful partner in Washington, and this tour is just one more example that my commitment to all the families of the Fourth Congressional District. From workforce development and training to infrastructure to economic development – federal-local partnership is key to moving our shared priorities forward. I will continue to work to improve collaboration and better align federal engagement with Anne Arundel County’s goals and long-term vision.

Black Americans are increasingly faced with fewer paths to the #AmericanDream, and it undermines their ability to get ahead. The median income for African Americans was $39,490 last year, compared to the overall median U.S. household income of about $59,000. This unsettling trend shows that our communities are continuously met with systemic forms of discrimination, and have not truly recovered from the 2008 Recession.   We must give all people an equal path to success by investing in #WorkforceTraining, #CommunityDevelopment, #education and #infrastructure. By confronting the inequality that permeates our cities, workplaces and college campuses, we will give people an equal playing field to safely raise a family and pursue their dreams.

With plenty of available shovel-ready land, a diverse, well-educated population, and a network of highways, airports and public transit, Prince George’s County is a premier location for Amazon’s #HQ2. With economic development in all parts of the County – Prince George's is great place to work, play and raise a family. We should act together to bring this $5 billion in investment and 50,000 new jobs to #Maryland.

The Congressional Black Caucus Foundation's (CBCF) Veterans Braintrust continues to play an important role in supporting African American #veterans, their families and communities. By 2040, minorities are expected to make up nearly 40 percent of all living veterans – and we must ensure that the VA is equipped to respond to the needs of these changing demographics.   So on Friday as a part of the CBCF’s 47th Annual Legislative Conference (#CBCFALC17), I will be holding a discussion with members of Congress, VA officials and other stakeholders to talk about how we can support black and women veterans in #Maryland and nationwide. All are welcome to attend!  Follow this link for more information: http://www.cbcfinc.org/annual-legislative-conference/

For the first time in its 250-year history, the Marine Corps will have a female infantry officer. Of the marines who attend the 13-week Infantry Officer Training Course (IOC), nearly 25 percent fail. While her name has not yet been disclosed, her commitment to her country should be commended for her sacrifice, bravery and completing one of the toughest training programs in the world. She is a trailblazer, and we must continuously work make the Armed Forces an inclusive place to all who are ready, willing and able to serve.
Today, we remember the countless families who have given their sons and daughters to defend our country and what it stands for. May we aim to be worthy of that sacrifice #GoldStarMothersDay

Pepco is filling high-wage jobs in the utility industry with opportunity for advancement. Get ready for these jobs by participating in the Prince George's County Energy Academy Initiative Workforce Training Program which will give you the opportunity to complete the pre-employment process and interview with Pepco.  The meeting is October 3rd – I urge all interested to attend!    RSVP here: http://www.pgcedc.com/events/pepco-job-seeker-information-session-2
Today, on football Sunday, I agree with President Trump's good friend Robert Kraft, owner of the defending Super Bowl Champions New England Patriots.
Great to speak with #MD04’s Congressional Art Competition winner Caleb Ogunmoyera last week. I love seeing the piece on my way to the Capitol. Keep up the great work Caleb!

Today, we honor the courage of the #LittleRockNine and recommit to fulfilling the Brown v. Board decision. Equal opportunity in education is a right for all - but it is being denied to millions of students across the country who attend dilapidated schools without well-paid, experienced teachers and sufficient resources. We must work to end segregation and close disparities for our communities of color in #Maryland and across the country.

#DREAMers are our friends, neighbors, family members and colleagues. They are hard-working Americans who contribute to our economy, join the Armed Services and pay taxes. Plain and simple, it is time to pass the #DREAMAct and grant them the full protection of the law.   That is why I joined the Congressional Hispanic Caucus and my Democratic colleagues in signing the discharge petition to force a vote on this important issue. We cannot continue to push DREAMers off to the side any longer – I will continue to stand with them and do everything I can to pass this legislation.

I stood with my colleagues from both sides of the aisle and voted for disaster relief for #Harvey and #Irma. Now it is time to work together on an aid package for #PuertoRico. 3.4 million American citizens are in desperate need of basic resources, and we cannot afford to wait any longer to help them. The Trump Administration’s response to this potential humanitarian crisis has been woefully late – our fellow Americans deserve more than tweets from their President.  Follow this link for additional resources on helping family and friends in Puerto Rico: http://bit.ly/2xJirlb

Thanks to the activism of the American people, we were able to #ProtectOurCare and stop #TrumpCare once and for all. While Republicans have gone back and forth for months – rushing from one attempt to another – it is time to craft a bipartisan solution that benefits our seniors, veterans, women, those with pre-existing conditions and working families. All Americans have the right to affordable, quality health care, and we must work together to lower costs and expand coverage for all.

There’s been a rising tide of hate across schools and institutions of higher learning, and our students are continuously being exposed to racist symbols and hate-speech. Yesterday, ten #Confederate flags with cotton pinned to them were found on the grounds of #AmericanUniversity in Washington, DC.  These findings come on the same day Attorney General Jeff Sessions spoke at Georgetown claiming so-called “free speech” to be under attack. While I agree our schools should remain open to diverse perspectives, the federal government should not actively defend those spread hate symbols on our college campuses. Those who commit acts of hate – like the one on American University’s campus – are not engaging in a civilized debate, they’re exploiting the Constitution to sow fear and hatred. This is not a free speech issue; it is a blatant attempt to scare and intimidate minority students – and we must act.

I agree with Marine General Joseph Dunford, Chairman of the Joints Chiefs of Staff. #Transgender troops should not be discriminated against because of their gender identity. Anyone who is ready, willing and able to serve should have the right and privilege to join the Armed Services. #TransRightsAreHumanRights

Our fellow Americans are suffering and this Administration has to do more. We are an immensely powerful country. The full might of the United States military should be deployed.   Our Armed Forces are expeditionary. They go where we send them and where others cannot. Marines land on beaches that no tourist would ever visit. The Air Force lands planes where commercial airlines wouldn't even consider. The Army crosses obstacles over rough terrain that would stop most people. And the Navy off-loads vessels in places where ports don't even exist. That's what we do in faraway places and hot spots around the globe, so let's do it now for our fellow citizens in #PuertoRico and the #VirginIslands.

As a retired US Army Reserve Colonel with 30 years of experience, I fought for people’s right to express themselves in a peaceful, nonviolent way. Nonviolent protest is intended to make people uncomfortable and draw attention to underlying issues. So I fully support Colin Kaepernick and others, who want to kneel to protest police brutality, discrimination, and other issues that negatively impact the citizens of this great country.

Thanks to skilled faculty and dedicated students, Shipley’s Choice Elementary in Anne Arundel County has been named a Blue Ribbon School! The school has made great strides in closing achievement gaps and helping students excel in reading and mathematics. Investing in young students is always a win-win, and sets them up for success in their future. Congratulations!

"If you can't treat someone with dignity and respect, then get out," says Superintendent of the United States Air Force Academy, Lt. Gen. Silveria to the Cadet Wing. Same message that needs to be delivered on college campuses around the country, military and civilian.

Our thoughts and prayers go out to the innocent men and women in #LasVegas whose lives were stolen from them during our nation’s largest mass shooting. Their families and loved ones will remain in our hearts as we vow to never give in to fear, violence or hatred.

At the age of 14, Tory Ridgeway of Boy Scout Troop 487, chartered through Ebenezer AME church, advanced to the rank of Eagle Scout – an achievement only 5 percent of entering Boy Scouts earn. While Tory is autistic, he never allows his disability to hold him back or stop him from being an upstanding member of our community. Mr. Ridgeway has aspirations to attend the Naval Academy and go to college, and I have no doubt he will be a tremendous asset to the U.S. Armed Forces. It was privilege to speak at his Eagle Scout Court of Honor this weekend, and I look forward to his exceptionally bright future. Congratulations, Tory!

Our hearts go out to #AnneArundel grad #TinaFrost who was injured in the #LasVegas shooting Sunday night. Her family and loved ones are foremost in our thoughts during this incredibly stressful and uncertain time. As Tina traveled from San Diego with her boyfriend to see one of her favorite country music artists, she posted on social media and spoke with her sister about how excited she was. Described as a star soccer player with a smile that could light up a room, we pray God's abundant mercy and grace encompass Tina.

The new 5-4 majority on the Supreme Court would destroy #unions across the country, handing powerful corporations another victory at the expense of working men and women. Unions have fought for workplace protections, won employer-based health coverage, and ended childhood labor, and now Conservatives are trying to cut them off at the knees – just as #GOP has done across the country. And why is that? Unions support a higher minimum wage and better benefits, and raise the standard of living for everyone. Let's stand with the American worker and ensure their ability to organize and bargain.
Today, I'm standing with fellow House Democrats to demand a vote on commonsense gun safety measures. We must work together to #EndGunViolence in our communities and across the United States.

On the same week Congress allowed #CHIP to expire, Republicans are back to playing politics and again trying to restrict women's rights and access to health care. They pushed #HR36 that is based on dubious science and disproportionately affects young women of color. This comes after Republicans have already slashed Medicaid, reinstated pregnancy as a preexisting condition, repeatedly attacked Planned Parenthood and reinstated the Global Gag Rule. I will remain committed to the protection of women's health and to supporting women and families in the choices they make. #StopTheBans

No American needs a #BumpStock for responsible gun ownership. So that’s why I’m sponsoring legislation with 139 of my fellow Democrats to ban the device. We cannot follow #LasVegas with more inaction. It's time for #Republicans to step up to the plate and vote for commonsense gun reform.   Read my full release here: bit.ly/2yKlVRD

A nation's budget should reflect its priorities, but the #GOPBudget continues to push the wrong ones: Catering to the wealthy and special interests. The GOP budget will devastate our economy by balancing the budget on the backs of students, workers, seniors, the disabled and vulnerable communities in #Maryland and across our country.   In stark contrast, the #CBCBudget would create a fairer tax code and provide for much needed investments in our communities. Our budget would boost our GDP by $329 billion and create 2 million jobs. We need a budget that invests in the future and opens doors to the #AmericanDream for all people.

#GoldStarFamilies have given their sons & daughters to the United States. I'm proud to stand with colleagues from both sides of the aisle as we recommit to Gold Star Families and ensure they have the benefits they deserve.

Much like the #GOPBudget, the Republican #TaxPlan would be devastating for middle-class Marylanders, and would offer a massive tax break to wealthy corporations. We need a fairer tax system that helps working families and small businesses, makes us more competitive, and expands pathways to the American Dream. The GOP tax plan has no details but it is clear that they’re choosing to give trillions in tax cuts to the top 1% and wealthy corporations all at our expense.

While I understand the President’s concern about nation building and instilling western institutions in Afghanistan, nobody can help reestablish civil institutions and a regional economies better than the United States. Our Armed Forces are the best at training foreign militaries, and it’s our State Department and our USAID that does diplomacy and development better than any other nation. Moving forward, our strategy in the Middle East must be a whole of government approach that utilizes both our military and our diplomatic resources to ensure long-term security throughout the region.

This is one more maneuver in the war the Trump Administration is waging on the health care of women and the American people. From the 20-week #AbortionBan, to the expiration of #CHIP, and now the rolling back of the contraception rule, Republicans are on a mission to strip care away from millions. For many working women, the coverage of preventative care allows them to make their rent, pay their bills and take care of their families. The Trump Administration shouldn’t be forcing them to make decisions on these basic necessities like their health care.   We should be working to expand access to affordable care and ensure women – especially women of color – have access to the resources they need. #ProtectOurCare

As our country grapples with rising hate and extremism, an economy where the American Dream seems out of reach for too many, and a President that sows discord at every turn, it is fitting that we remember the 100th birthday of #FannieLouHamer. Ms. Hamer went from a sharecropper in the Mississippi Delta to a national icon for civil rights who never stopped fighting. She never stopped fighting for equality; she never stopped fighting for the right to vote; she never stopped fighting the racist brutality of law enforcement. So in her memory, we vow to never stop fighting for true equality, no matter how sick and tired of being sick and tired we become.
Join me at my town hall at 10AM tomorrow in Ft. Washington. All voices and communities are welcome.  RSVP here: http://bit.ly/2hRXZIE
Thank you to those who came out to the town hall in Ft. Washington today. Let's make sure everyone has a say and a seat at the table.

Frederick County School Board sets transgender policy. Local resident states, “We see this as being on the right side of history, and an overall sign of fairness.”  Great move Frederick County Public Schools supporting the LGBT Community!

Working families, particularly minority families, often bear the brunt of environmental hazards while experiencing almost none of the economic benefits. The #CleanPowerPlan could have avoided an estimated 2,700 to 6,600 premature deaths and 140,000 to 150,000 asthma attacks in children. Instead, the Trump Administration chose to withdraw from the plan, jeopardizing the future health and well-being of millions.   The United States needs to be leading the charge when it comes to tackling #ClimateChange and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. We should be investing in clean energy, and preparing America to be competitive for the 21st century economy that looks forward. Today's reckless decision does not do that. #SaveCPP

On #NationalComingOutDay we recognize the bravery and courage of our #LGBT friends, family and neighbors. We’ve come a long way since #Stonewall in the fight for equal rights, but the job is far from over. As the Trump Administration continues to try to turn the clock back on civil rights, we must double down in our fight for equality among all people. Whether it’s on the lawns of our college campuses, within the ranks of our military, or in the homes of immigrant families, all people deserve to live in a safe and accepting world. Happy National Coming Out Day everyone!

As Americans continue to suffer in #PuertoRico and #USVI, we must do more. The President is not asking the military to do as much as it can, and wants to leave as our citizens face a humanitarian crisis. In fact, we deployed more men, ships and helicopters and airlifted more than 15,000 when Haiti suffered from an earthquake in 2010. If we could that then, we can certainly do better today.

The new #TrumpCare plans will undermine #ACA markets - forcing seniors, working families and people with pre-existing conditions to pay more for worse coverage. The Trump Administration is already doing its best effort to make it harder to enroll in health care plans, and now they are weakening protections for some of our most vulnerable Americans. We must work in a bipartisan fashion to expand access to affordable care for all Americans. #ProtectOurCare

Without an effective and accurate #Census, working families in #Maryland and across the country get left behind – it affects our budget, our representation in Congress, and critical investments in our schools, affordable housing and infrastructure. Both government and businesses need a fully funded Census to help them decide where to invest resources and make decisions that affect the lives of every Marylander. It is disappointing that year after year, Republicans continue to dangerously under-fund the U.S. Census Bureau, and I urge my colleagues to finally sufficiently fund this important part of the democratic process.

As we celebrate #HispanicHeritageMonth – and acknowledge the rich contributions of Hispanic Americans to our culture, economy and Armed Services – let us not forget the work that lies ahead. We must continue to work together to create ladders of opportunity for Hispanic communities both in Maryland and across the country. Let’s pass the #DREAMAct and ensure all victims of Hurricane Maria have the resources they need to recover. As we near the end of Hispanic Heritage Month, let’s renew our commitment to the diversity that strengthens us, and ensure our country is a more prosperous place for all people.

When Ella was diagnosed with cancer, her parents found health insurance through the MD Health Exchange - instead of paying $80,000 out of pocket, they paid an exponentially lower amount for Ella’s chemotherapy. Trump’s decision to end cost-sharing subsidies would destroy the ability for working families to get affordable treatment without being denied coverage for having a pre-existing condition. Together, we need to #ProtectOurCare and ensure middle-income families like Ella's have access to quality, affordable health services.

Come show your support for #SuicidePrevention today at the first annual Suicide Day of Awareness Walk at the National Harbor Woodrow Wilson Trail. Suicide is one of the leading causes of death in the United States – especially for our veterans, and we must do more to combat this awful trend. Let’s use this opportunity to recommit ourselves to our friends, neighbors and loved ones, and showing our communities that suicide is never the answer.

A nuclear-armed #Iran - today, tomorrow or anytime in the future - is not an acceptable option. While the #IranDeal is imperfect, the International Atomic Energy Agency, our allies and even the President’s own foreign policy team have confirmed that Iran is in compliance with the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action’s nuclear commitments and is currently subject to the world’s most robust nuclear verification regime. Rather than engaging our allies and the international community on how we can address Iran’s dangerous activities and strengthen the nuclear agreement, President Trump is abdicating his responsibility.   President Trump not only has a duty to protect our national security interests, but also to ensure the United States remains a trustworthy and reliable leader in the international community. Decertifying the Iran nuclear agreement at this point only serves to obstruct our ability to ensure vigorous nuclear inspections, restrict Iran’s weapons sales, limit its ballistic missile program, and confront Iran’s continued violations of international law, support for terrorism and abuse of human rights.

Great schools beget great students. And the more we invest in schools and educators, the brighter futures our students will have. This three-year, $24 million grant will go to some of our most in-need schools, giving our teachers and principals the tools they need to prepare our kids for the future. Thank you to all educators who work every day to make sure our kids have the ability to pursue the #AmericanDream.

After an earthquake hit Haiti in 2010, the U.S. military mobilized as if we were going to war. Immediately after the earthquake, an Army unit was airborne. Within two weeks, 33 ships and 22,000 thousand soldiers had arrived, and more than 300 helicopters were delivering millions of pounds of food and water not just to the port, but also to the people of Haiti. So yes Mr. President, we should be using the full capacity of the U.S. military to deliver resources directly to American citizens who are still struggling in #PuertoRico and #USVI – it’s the right thing to do, and your response to #HurricaneMaria is costing lives.

50,000 open positions at the VA is a national disgrace. Men and women who wear the uniform deserve the best possible care and benefits available to them. We must work to ensure every VA facility is fully staffed with top-notch professionals to ensure our #veterans are taken care of when they come home.

Today we moved closer to delivering justice for #RichardCollinsIII as his murderer was indicted for a hate crime by a grand jury. As we have seen across the country, these are not isolated incidents – they are heinous and unprovoked acts of malice. This escalation is not going to stop unless we take a stand, and work together to stem the rising tide of hate in our communities and on our college campuses. While this indictment is a step in the right direction, we all have a responsibility to confront racism in our neighborhoods, workplaces and criminal justice system. Let’s not wait for another tragedy to take action.

Back in August, I held a discussion at the University of Maryland on the rising tide of hate crimes on college campuses. We had a productive conversation and outlined the ways we can stand up to hate in our schools and neighborhoods. With the news regarding the murderer of #RichardCollinsIII yesterday, we continue to take steps to deliver justice to his family and loved ones. It is up to us to work together to take hate seriously and let its perpetrators know that it has no place in our communities.

#Cybersecurity must be a priority as we work strengthen our national defense apparatus. We continue to fall victim to data breaches – like the #Equifax incident in May that exposed the information of nearly 146 million Americans and the 2015 attack where 21.5 million records were stolen from OPM – that put people’s livelihoods at risk. National #CyberSecurityAwarenessMonth reminds us that as the Internet becomes more entrenched in our daily lives and the operations of the government, we must strive to prevent these attacks and guarantee an organized, effective response if attack does occur. We need to take commonsense steps to protect civil servants from data breaches, and ensure information theft does not become a further occupational hazard of federal employment.   Read more about my bill here: http://bit.ly/2xQUyJr

From day one, the Trump Administration and Congressional Republicans have consistently tried to undermine our right to affordable, quality healthcare. #Medicaid and #CHIP cover 1.3 million Marylanders alone, and we must continue to fight against their attempts to weaken the Affordable Care Act and strip care away from millions of Americans.   Join me October 30th for a free and open Medicaid town hall at 6:30PM at Prince George's Community College in Largo to share how this important program has impacted you.
I'm proud to stand with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to raise awareness and advance research efforts. #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth

This #GOPBudget pushes all the wrong priorities – paving the way for a gigantic tax cut for millionaires and billionaires. They keep telling us that if we cut our investments in job training and research – and give the wealthy massive tax breaks – it will magically translate into more jobs and a stronger economy. Except we tried this before – it led to the slowest job growth in 50 years, and families saw their incomes fall.   We shouldn’t sacrifice trillions of dollars to infrastructure, research, workforce development, Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security to give the top one percent and big corporations a tax cut. In our country, prosperity has never trickled down from the success of the few. Working families need #ABetterDeal – one that grows the economy and allows Americans to get ahead.

Rosamaria – a 10 year old child with cerebral palsy – was on her way to surgery when she was detained by immigration forces in Texas. This heartless action by the Trump Administration is inhumane and un-American. I strongly question why the White House is treating this small child like a dangerous criminal – she is no threat to our safety or our country. I urge DHS to seriously reconsider their priorities.

I saw firsthand the ongoing recovery efforts in #PuertoRico and #USVI during my trip over the weekend. While we still have a long way to go, this is an incredible and selfless act from one outstanding member of our community. DaShai Morton of North Forestville Elementary School is donating 500 cases of water to victims of Hurricanes Irma and Maria. Her work is an example for us all to follow as we look for ways to extend our hand to our fellow Americans. Keep up the great work DaShai!

19 years ago, Matthew Shepard and James Byrd Jr. were both brutally murdered simply for being who they were. Matthew Shepard was beaten and left on a dirt road to die for who he loved, James Byrd Jr. was dragged by truck for three miles for the color of his skin. 19 years onward, Lieutenant Richard Collins III was killed simply for the color of his skin. While we have made leaps of progress in fostering a more welcoming country for all, the Trump Administration is working on a daily basis to undermine true American values and roll back years worth of critical protections.  If we wait for tragedies to spur action, we are already too late. We must never stop fighting for the right of all Americans to receive justice, and live a life free of violence and persecution. On the 8th anniversary of the Matthew Shepard and James Byrd Jr. Hate Crimes Prevention Act, let us recommit ourselves to standing up to hate in all forms wherever it manifests itself.

Over the weekend, I traveled to #PuertoRico and #USVI with some of my colleagues from both sides of the aisle to see the hurricane damage and what #OurFellowAmericans are going through. It’s one thing to read the news reports of the devastation, but entirely different to experience it firsthand. With the majority of people still without electricity and essential resources - along with severely limited access to infrastructure - the road to full recovery is a long one. While aid organizations and DoD work day and night, we in Congress must do our part to ensure the people of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands have everything they need to rebuild their homes and communities.   I am moved and inspired by the strength and resilience shown by the victims of Hurricanes Irma and Maria. Their commitment to helping their neighbors in the face of such tragedy is a lesson we can all learn from. I thank the Members of the delegation who joined throughout the weekend, and I will continue to stand with our fellow Americans in Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands during this incredibly challenging moment in our nation’s history.   Photos courtesy of Steven Shepard, Photojournalist, FEMA

Today I toured Anne Arundel Medical Center (AAMC) with Chris Van Hollen and I remain committed to ensuring Marylanders have the high quality, affordable health care they need. AAMC continues to be an upstanding community partner and a cornerstone that Marylanders can rely on for their care.   Yet, this tour reminds us that there are steps Congress should take today to strengthen our healthcare system and stabilize our private health insurance markets. This includes funding cost-sharing reduction payments for lower income Americans, renewing the Children’s Health Insurance Program (#CHIP), and making the investments to improve care for those with substance use disorders.

The groundbreaking for the new #USCIS headquarters represents a major win for the people of Prince George's County. By creating thousands of jobs, this project will be an economic catalyst for the surrounding community and will create ladders of opportunity for hardworking Maryland families. Prince George’s County remains well-positioned to receive top consideration from agencies and new businesses looking to establish themselves in a location with walkable communities where today’s employees want to live, work and play.

We’re glad to see #TinaFrost in stronger condition, and we’ll keep praying for her as she recovers. We continue to mourn those who lost their lives in #LasVegas, but we must never forget people like Tina, who carry a special burden as she and her loved ones reconstruct a new life in the wake of a national tragedy. The effects of mass shootings extend beyond the day of the incident; they reach into the days, months and years afterward. All of the survivors of the shooting will remain in our hearts as they demonstrate a lifetime of strength and perseverance many of us will never know.

It’s one thing to read the news reports of the devastation, but entirely different to experience it firsthand. With the majority of people still without electricity and essential resources - along with severely limited access to infrastructure - the road to full recovery is a long one. While aid organizations and DoD work day and night, we in Congress must do our part to ensure the people of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands have everything they need to rebuild their homes and communities. During National Native American Heritage Month, we observe the rich contributions of Native Americans to the fabric of our society. Specifically, we recognize the Piscataway peoples – who have long been residents of Southern Maryland before the founding of the United States – for their persistence and courage. Whether it’s through environmental advocacy, political activism or serving in the Armed Forces, Native Americans continue to overcome despite generations of injustice and inequality. This month, let’s strengthen our commitment to Tribal Nations and expanding equality, justice and opportunity to all people.

When there have been 154 total hate incidents at more than 120 college campuses since the 2016 election, universities must get off the sidelines and do their part to combat the rising tide of hate across the country.   That’s why I’m introducing the Campus Hate Crimes Act, to ensure universities are held accountable for #HateCrimes that occur on campus. We're pushing back against extremists efforts to target the developing minds of young students and ferment intolerance, hatred and violence. As we continue to seek justice for #RichardCollinsIII and his family, we cannot wait for another tragedy to take action. We must stand up straight, look hate in the eye, and let it know that it has no place in our campuses, classrooms or schools.   Read my full release here: http://bit.ly/2ikTcML
Proud to stand in solidarity with my colleagues to call for additional federal aid for #PuertoRico and #USVI. #OurFellowAmericans

Ensuring the health and well-being of our nation’s children is one of our highest priorities. Or at least it used to be. #CHIP covers 138,000 kids in Maryland and covers 95 percent of children nationwide. Instead of reauthorizing this important program in a bipartisan way as we usually do, Republicans chose to play politics with the health care of children by sabotaging the #ACA, raising premiums on our seniors and cutting the Public Health Prevention fund.
Thanks to everyone who joined our 23rd town hall today. Your engagement and feedback is key to making our community better for all people.

The #GOPTaxPlan puts the interests of the 1% and big corporations over millions of working families across the United States. This is the opposite kind of “reform” hardworking Americans need and deserve. Working moms and dads can’t simply hope that corporate tax cuts turn into profits that trickle down to them. We need to invest in economic growth – not the #GOPTaxScam.

The #GOPTaxScam will raise taxes on 38 million working families across the country. And why does Donald Trump want to do that? To give a “huge” tax break to billionaires and corporations, and make it easier for them to ship jobs overseas.   We need a tax plan that invests in education and the development of a 21st century workforce. One that gives #ABetterDeal to Marylanders and helps them get family sustaining jobs. While the #GOPTaxPlan will hurt millions of Americans, I stand ready to work together to develop a bipartisan tax plan that helps people and ensures everyone pays their fair share.

In the state of #Maryland, there are nearly 23,000 #TPS holders, making it the sixth highest state in the country. And in the Fourth District we have 4,000, making it one of the top five districts in the country. TPS holders have raised their families here in the United States for over 20 years and have been woven into the fabric of our communities.   So as the Trump Administration threatens to deport them in mere months, I urge my colleagues to ensure TPS holders can stay and pursue an earned path to citizenship. #SaveTPS

The recent #GOPTaxScam reflects their real priorities – tax breaks for the wealthy at the expense of everyone else. Even those who have put their lives on the line for the United States. By eliminating these key tax credits and deductions, President Trump is making it more expensive for vets to go to school and get jobs. As #VeteransDay approaches this weekend, we should recommit to supporting veterans at home and abroad, not dismantling their ability to get hired or get an education.

#VeteransDay celebrates the men and women who are willing to put on the military uniform and embrace the ethos of duty, honor and country. Because of these service-members our country hasn't just endured, we've thrived and remain the greatest nation in the world.   Our troops may wear the uniform only for a time, but they proudly wear the title of "veteran" for the rest of their lives.  As a nation, we must ensure we have the best trained and equipped military, but we must do even more to making sure we have the best treated and best cared for veterans as well.  From one veteran to another, thank you for your service to our great nation.

Working families in our region would be one of the groups hardest hit by the #GOPTaxScam. I've met so many people who aspire to own their own home one day - it's the American Dream - but Republicans are making it harder and harder. Why? To give billionaires and big corporations huge tax cuts

The #GOPTaxScam would result in $250 billion in cuts to public education and put 250,000 school jobs at risk - including more than 7,000 in Maryland. This will lead to more overcrowded classrooms and our kids not getting the attention or quality teaching they need to success.   I'm not going to give massive tax cuts to the rich paid for on the backs of our children.

In 1960, 6-year old Ruby Bridges became a trailblazer when she bravely walked past a violent mob of angry protesters to become the first African American student to integrate an all-white school. She wasn't afraid that day - she just kept looking and moving forward.  Her bravery continues to inspire us. Change is not easy, but easy has never been promised to us. Despite the naysayers or those who will always resist progress, we have to keep fighting to end discrimination and widen opportunity.

In their rush to give huge tax cuts to the rich and big corporations, Republicans are ignoring those aspects of tax reform that will support working families, create jobs and grow our economy. That's why I introduced an amendment to create a new tax credit to expand workforce development. Investments in worker skills and training improves productivity, jump starts innovation and provides pathways to better paying jobs.   Even though this idea has bipartisan support, Republicans blocked my amendment from even being debated. I want a fairer tax code that strengthens the middle class and makes America more competitive. But this bill doesn't do that! #GOPTaxScam

The #GOPTaxScam passed the House on a party-line vote. This plan is a huge giveaway to the rich and big corporations paid for on the back of teachers, seniors, students, the disabled and working families. Worse yet, this bill hurts our nation's veterans.   With millions of veterans still underemployed or stuck in low wage jobs, the GOP decided eliminate a tax credit to help veterans find meaningful employment. No veteran should fight for a job at home, after they fight for our nation overseas.

This week construction started at the Town Square at Suitland Federal Center - a new sustainable mixed-use development that will truly reignite and transform the Suitland community.   Just steps away from thousands of federal jobs and the Suitland Metro Station, this pedestrian-friendly project will add green space, entertainment and new amenities - and draw families and local businesses to the area. Another game changer for Prince George's County!

In order to compete and win in today's global economy the US needs  stronger workforce with expertise in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). But the #GOPTaxScam is a huge step backwards - making graduate degree too costly to pursue and keeping students from pursuing STEM fields.  We should be investing in our students, not asking them to pay for huge tax cuts to the rich.

An open Internet is critical to our economy and our way of life. It has unlocked new opportunities, brought communities closer together that has led to remarkable innovation,entrepreneurship and growth. But a free and fair Internet - where all traffic is treated equally - is in grave danger. The Trump Administration is pushing to repeal Obama-era net neutrality rules that will throttle access, interrupt the free flow of information and pick winners and losers in the online marketplace of ideas and services.  I am committed to a free and open Internet, and Congress must work to #SaveNetNeutrality

As we prepare to share a Thanksgiving meal with family and friends, there are hundreds of thousands of families in our region who struggle to put food on the table everyday. Organizations like Capital Area Food Bank are making a big difference -ensuring no table is bare during the holidays. But we have much more work to do to see no family - and no child - ever goes hungry.

Thanksgiving Day is an opportunity to reflect on our many blessings: the freedoms we cherish; the time we can spend with family and loved ones; and, the brave men and women in uniform who defend us at home and abroad.   But on this day of gratitude, let us recommit ourselves to the values we share and  work that remains undone. Everyday we must do more to build a just, tolerant and inclusive country where no one is left behind.  From my family to yours, Happy Thanksgiving

On Small Business Saturday we support our small businesses and celebrate all they do for our communities. This holiday season I encourage you to #ShopSmall and make your next purchase at a small business!

This morning I unveiled the 'WMATA Flexible Funding and Safety Improvement Act' with Rep. Jamie Raskin and ATU Local 689.   A strong, safe and reliable Metro is key to getting people around, attracting businesses and creating good-paying jobs, and reducing congestion and carbon emissions. But over the last few years, residents of Maryland, Virginia and the District of Columbia have been forced to wait longer, pay more, and realize they can no longer rely on Metro. Mediocre, substandard service, and higher and higher fares, cannot be the new normal.   This bill will bring more people back to Metro by exploring innovative ideas and holding the line on fare increases, fosters a permanent safety culture at WMATA, and ensures we provide high quality service for elderly riders and people with disabilities.”

After the tragic death of Richard Collins III in a crime of hate, the University of Maryland is taking important steps to address this unfortunate new normal where white supremacists and other hate groups are targeting campuses more than ever. A full-time hate-bias response coordinator and new bias response team will be key to responding to hate groups trying to stir up trouble at Maryland.  Earlier this year I introduced the CAMPUS Hate Crimes Act, to ensure university officials are held accountable for hate crimes and hate-based incidents that occur on their campuses. In this charged climate, we must do more to keep our students safe.

After more than three decades of persistence and investment, Prince George’s County will finally be home to a state of the art Regional Medical Center that will transform healthcare delivery in our region and provide our families with the high quality care they deserve.   By bringing together federal, state, local and private-sector resources we will expand access to innovation, cures and treatment; create thousands of jobs; and trigger billions of dollars in new economic development.

The #GOPTaxScam is being marketed as an enormous tax cut for working families, but it is anything but.    "Many view the legislation not as a product of genuine deliberation, but as a transfer of wealth to corporations and affluent individuals — both generous purveyors of campaign contributions. By 2027, people making $40,000 to $50,000 would pay a combined $5.3 billion more in taxes, while the group earning $1 million or more would get a $5.8 billion cut"

This must be a watershed moment in our country. As courageous men and women around the country are speaking up and making their voices heard, we must end the pervasive culture of sexual harassment that has been ignored or covered up for far too long - including here on Capitol Hill. As Members of Congress we have a moral responsibility to foster a climate of dignity and respect, and to eliminate abuse, discrimination, harassment, and retaliation of any kind. Those who commit these despicable acts, must suffer the appropriate consequences.  As a member of the House Ethics Committee, I cannot publicly speak about any specific situation but I strongly support the Committee’s plan to review all formal claims of sexual harassment, discrimination and treatment involving both members and staff. Sexual harassment and discrimination are prohibited by federal law and by House Rules, and the Committee should fully investigate all these allegations and recommend punishment if necessary.

Thanks to the vision and hard work of many people including County Executive Rushern Baker and Martin O'Malley, we finally broke ground on the new UM Capital Region Health Medical Center in Prince George's County. It will become a high-quality, central medical hub for entire region that will attract patients and top physicians - who for far too long have looked elsewhere for care.   This will be an outstanding hospital with tremendous potential to ensure our families lead healthier and stronger lives.

Just a few days after Rosa Parks' arrest for refusing to give up her seat on a segregated bus, a little known pastor named Martin Luther King Jr. stood by her side and began the Montgomery Bus Boycott. This was a turning point in American history when we began the long march toward the Civil Rights Movement that spread across the country and led to the eventual outlawing of segregation and discrimination.   As we commemorate the anniversary of Boycott, we must recommit ourselves to their march for justice and equality. We have much more work to do to keep perfecting our union.

The House is voting on the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act - the NRA's highest legislative priority - which would gut local gun laws and allow firearms into our schools, malls and neighborhoods. But this bill also endangers victims of domestic abuse, dating violence and stalking - as abusers will now be able to get a gun and hide it. The facts are clear - if abusers have access to guns, victims are five times more likely to be killed.  I have fought to increase protections for domestic violence and abuse victims, and unfortunately this bill will mean those efforts was all for naught. We have to do better.

Despite two of the five worst mass shootings in American history occurring in the past two months, President Trump and Congressional Republicans are trying to weaken our gun laws and allow dangerous criminals to carry loaded, concealed guns in public spaces without ever having passed a background check.  That's why I joined Everytown for Gun Safety, Giffords and Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America to fight against this bill. We should doing more to take guns off our streets and out of our neighborhoods.

Today we remember the 2,400 patriots who gave their lives at Pearl Harbor - many from Maryland or graduates of the Naval Academy. Harry H. Gaver Jr., son of a Naval Academy professor and Marine officer, died aboard the USS Oklahoma. Joe Heinzmann, a radioman aboard the USS Raleigh, rushed back to his post as the attack began. Gene Showe, ran ammunition to anti-aircraft batteries that shot down four Japanese planes.   Their courage and sacrifice helped forge an enduring peace and powered American prosperity for a generation. Today we affirm our work to not only strengthen and secure our nation, but to care and support our veterans.

Even as Republicans race to send President Trump a tax bill that will harm working families, the worst is yet to come. Cuts to Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid are next.   After giving the wealthy and big corporations a budget-busting trillion dollar tax cut, Republicans are shamelessly going to argue that our national debt demands we destroy our social safety net.

Children's National Medical Center has been committed to helping our region's children grow up healthy and strong, and this new, state-of-the-art pediatric specialty care center in Prince George's County will enable more kids and families to have access to world-class care closer to home.   This is an exciting addition to Glenarden and will perfectly complement our new Regional Medical Center.

As we approach the end of the year, Congress has a long to-do list - funding our government, reauthorizing children's healthcare, protecting our DREAMers, and defeating the #GOPTaxScam. Before we vote, I want to hear from you.   Join me at my last town hall of 2017 on Saturday in Largo!

During the eight nights of Hanukkah, we remember that even the smallest light can shine through darkness and we renew our faith in the possibility of miracle both great and small.    From my family to yours, Chag Sameach!
I didn't think it was possible but Republicans are trying to squeeze working families even more in order to give the wealthy even bigger tax cuts.  No wonder this bill is 'bigly' unpopular

I strongly support a free and fair Internet. Net Neutrality has been a founding principle of the Internet, and no corporation should be able to restrict access or pick winners and losers online.   Like most of my constituents and millions of Americans, I oppose the FCC's decision to rollback net neutrality protections. But the fight doesn't end today, and it is now on Congress to boldly act to preserve an open Internet for all.

I commend Governor McAuliffe for joining a growing group of regional leaders and advocates in proposing a dedicated funding source to ensure the long-term, steady financing required for a safe and reliable Metro.   Long-term dedicated funding is critical to improving Metro’s service and increasing capital investments. In 2008, Maryland led the region by dedicating a funding stream to WMATA from existing infrastructure resources. Virginia and the District have now put forward proposals for long-term dedicated funding; Maryland and the federal government must do the same.   Let me be clear. Any meaningful solution to Metro must make a long-term commitment to Metro’s future, its ridership and the men and women who operate and maintain it daily.

The latest independent analysis of the #GOPTaxScam is real bad news for working families. 83% of the bill's benefits go to the top 1% - those making more than $900,000 a year. The top 0.1% - the richest of the rich earning $5 million or more - are handed a  $148,260 tax cut.   At the same time, more than half of Americans - 86 million families - would pay more.

U.S. global leadership under President Trump is faltering. The President’s first National Security Strategy attempts to address our role in the world and our security priorities, but the document is entirely disconnected from what the President actually believes and the erratic and reactionary policies he is pursuing. The strategy is inward looking and fails to advance an international order based on our nation’s historic commitment to democratic ideals, human rights and the rule of law.   The Strategy calls Russia and China “rival powers,” but he seeks a cozy partnership with both; it trumpets U.S. international leadership, but our allies question whether they can depend on us as they once did; and, it calls upon us to “upgrade our diplomatic capabilities,” but this does not reconcile with the Administration’s draconian reductions at the State Department and USAID.   What or who should we believe? A piece of paper or what the President actually does?

A safe and reliable Metro is key to moving people around the region, growing our economy, and creating good-paying jobs. Establishing a long-term dedicated funding commitment is crucial to addressing Metro’s challenges, and I applaud Maryland Democrats - especially Senator Brian Feldman, Delegate Erek L. Barron and Delegate Marc Korman - for proposing a permanent reliable stream of revenue that mirrors the successful approach we took in 2008.    The time for talk is over. Maryland, Virginia, the District and the federal government must now make the hard decisions to permanently address WMATA's fiscal challenges and prevent the region's most critical transit system from further deteriorating.

9 million children - including 140,000 in Maryland - rely on the Children's Health Insurance Program for their healthcare. But for more than 80 days Congress has refused to renew the program, and now hundreds of thousands of families are about to receive notices informing them that their insurance is being canceled.   The program has enjoyed bipartisan support and Republicans shouldn't leave working families out in the cold hours after delivering massive tax cuts for corporations. Let's do the right things for our kids.

Today my family joins millions across the world in celebrating the birth of Jesus and the message he embodied: to feed the hungry and care for the sick; to be our brother's and sister's keeper; and most importantly, to love one another. This holiday season let us live out that message, and reconnect with the values that bind us all together and unite us as Americans.  Merry Christmas!
